label: guilt
text: "I live with my boyfriend, we have a close relationship, I fell in love with another man."

label: shame
text: I feel shy to show all my worth when I work for the first time with a conductor or a producer unfamiliar to me.

label: joy
text: When I heard that I had passed Primary School Leaving Certificate and was selected to go for Secondary education.

label: anger
text: "I confronted with this feeling at the Institute quite recently, the pedology lecturer was the cause."

label: joy
text: Found money on the road and returned it to the owner through police.

label: fear
text: On the way down a ski slope which was difficult and steep.

label: joy
text: When I go out with my friend with enough money and good sense to our favorite dancing.

label: sadness
text: I didn't get the job I wanted.

label: disgust
text: "A friend of mine was telling jokes which I felt to be very disgusting, especially because I was eating."

label: shame
text: I borrowed $ 20.00 from a friend and paid him back much later than I had originally intended.

label: anger
text: In the last year of the high school we had a huge fight between my group and the graduation commission (two students of my classroom) because they accused us unjustly of a gossip about them.

label: fear
text: I was on this amusement park ride at Marriots Great America. It went way up in the air and then around and around. Heights are not my favorite spots in life.

label: guilt
text: "A certain friend evokes positive feelings, when I am with him but negative feelings when he is not present. I feel the need to express those negative feelings. However, when I speak about him, I always think: Why do I like this, he does not deserve this, but still I do so."

label: guilt
text: When I cancelled an appointment with an idle story. Afterwards it appeared that the person had looked forward to it and reserved time for it.

label: anger
text: Bad food in the students' dining hall.

label: fear
text: When I saw a ghost.

label: fear
text: "Walking around the University at night by myself, having been previously warned of rapes, etc."

label: joy
text: Receiving my result slip (pass) on my birthday.

label: shame
text: I made a major mistake while learning how to use a computer programme and the teacher criticized me.

label: anger
text: When someone does something wrong which affects me negatively.

label: joy
text: Doing well in an examn.

label: anger
text: During a dance someone slashed my tires and dumped paint on my car. I had four other friends with me that I drove and furthermore it was raining.

label: fear
text: Suddenly met someone in the biology building at night.

label: joy
text: The inflammation of the ear of my child got cured and the doctor said that the ear was completely all right.

label: guilt
text: When someone is accused or punished instead of me.

label: anger
text: Finding out that I was deceived by a friend.

label: fear
text: My father has a chronic desease. In the autumn of 1983 he had a very strong fit or seizure.

label: shame
text: Saw the film about Eight Nations Army conquering Beijing.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I failed to take an exam though I had had enough time to read for it but I hadn't made use of it.

label: joy
text: When I was admitted to the Chinese universiity.

label: fear
text: Can think of no time that I have felt fear.

label: joy
text: Being elected as class leader.

label: guilt
text: I happened to have met one of my teachers in town during working hours. The badness was I didn't ask for permission to go out and I was guilty-conscious.

label: anger
text: In a discussion the leader wanted to stop because she was of the opinion that we were not involved and she misjudged our reactions as negative. We however only posed several questions which she couldn't answer.

label: shame
text: Several years ago I was caught riding the train without a ticket. The station-mistress treated me like a criminal almost.

label: anger
text: An unjust calumny concerning me.

label: fear
text: When I broke the window pane of my next door neighbour's house.

label: guilt
text: "I behaved in a nasty manner towards a friend, I said things which I could have said in a more friendly way. After that I felt guilty."

label: anger
text: "I moved to a flat. A friend who had lived there before, had left the flat in a terrible mess. I was very angry about that sloppiness and impudence."

label: fear
text: I had worries about a certain illness.

label: fear
text: When I was chased by a big dog near my house.

label: fear
text: When I whatched a horror film on a Friday 13th.

label: joy
text: After passing my Malawi Certificate of Education Exam and being selected to Kamuzu College of Nursing.

label: disgust
text: About my girlfriend's sister who is a viper as I discovered some time ago.

label: sadness
text: "I broke up with my boyfriend of seven months, but it was a very ""indepth"" relationship and so after feelings of grief and loss were over I felt an immense sadness."

label: guilt
text: The day I came home drunk after having attended a disco party.

label: disgust
text: The behaviour of people spitting everywhere.

label: joy
text: The joy came to me when I heard that I was going to start a Medical course at the Lilongwe School for Health Sciences.

label: shame
text: "My first real experience with a boy. We were alone. I was quite young and pretty naive and he was pretty crude and real, sort of, macho. It was dark, at night during the summer and we were talking."

label: sadness
text: "My son lives with my parents in the country and I feel this feeling always when leaving for Sofia, but the last time it was quite strong."

label: joy
text: When I passed my final examination at school.

label: anger
text: "A friend got angry and drove ""like a lunatic"" with me and others in his car. I was angry about his dangerous driving."

label: fear
text: After I had managed to fail my first year at University I was scared as to what I was going to do with my future. I didn't want a mundane 9-5 job and yet I didn't know if I could pay my way through an unsubsidized year at university to settle down and continue my studies.

label: sadness
text: "I spent a weekend in San Diego visiting my boyfriend Rob. We were at the airport and my plane was just about so leave. After saying goodbye, I boarded the plane. It was the hardest thing to do and it was a sad trip home."

label: disgust
text: "My classmate got a ""B"" for his homework while I only got a ""C"".  When we got the results he acted as if he did not merit this grade.  I found that his humility was hypocritical and I found it disgusting."

label: guilt
text: One saturday night I did some meaningless work and went to bed very late.  Next morning I had was very sleepy so I continued sleeping even though I had work to do and I missed the Sunday service.

label: fear
text: "While swimming, I hit my head at the bottom of the pool and required stitches. I later learned that the consequences could have been much more severe and that terrified me."

label: sadness
text: "Leaving home to move closer to University. As an oldest child, this experience was traumatic for both my parents and myself."

label: shame
text: When I was a child I played my mother a nasty trick to make her feel hurt.

label: sadness
text: "At one point in a relationship, my boyfriend was seeing an old flame more than me. At our confrontation tears were shed."

label: anger
text: A murder.

label: fear
text: Facing a mad dog.

label: sadness
text: "In the 12/83 my boyfriend asked me to forget him, as it would be easy."

label: joy
text: The time I learnt that I had passed my Malawi School leaving Certificate Examinations.

label: guilt
text: At a moment of affect I offended a person very close to me. He had given me ground for that but it was a trifling in comparison with the way I insulted him. A moment later I felt a sense of guilt.

label: shame
text: When I was given detention at secondary school.

label: guilt
text: I've had three midterms in the past two weeks and I hardly studied for any of them (like 1 or 2 days) I feel guilty that I hadn't studied and I got C's on all of them.

label: shame
text: I feel ashamed at the fact that even after 35 years of independence   70% of the Indian poulation is still below the poverty line.

label: sadness
text: "I was watching a sunset after my latest boyfriend left me and I realized that we would never watch sunsets again, probaly never see eachother again and none of it mattered."

label: sadness
text: "I was very sad when I did not get admission in the English college, as I had 1% less marks than they wanted."

label: joy
text: When my brother was born.

label: anger
text: When I got a low grade in an administration course.

label: disgust
text: "I feel disgust with some people when I see what they are capable of, including lack of any dignity, when trying to find a seat in the tram."

label: fear
text: One summer when I was camping with friends they devised and elaborate plan to scare me by having our camp attecked by a wild animal (one of them) and then convincing the campground was the home of a satanic organization.

label: guilt
text: "I was caught doing something bad and I bribed the person who caught me.  Later I felt very bad, maybe I should have paid for my bad behaviour."

label: shame
text: When I realized that I had a hole in my trousers after having gone for a walk.

label: sadness
text: "A friend of mine, who had repeated a year at school once before, did not pass the final examination and had to take it again half a year later."

label: anger
text: "One day I lent my tennis I just had washed to my sister because she asked it. I asked her not to soil it as I had just washed it. Next day I looked at the tennis, and it was dirty with wax. She could not have soiled it. It was lack of consideration. I felt very angry."

label: anger
text: My best friend betrayed me and told other people my secrets.

label: shame
text: I did badly in the mid term examination.

label: anger
text: "In 1983 a sadist provoked my sister in my presence.  He tried to force my sister into accompanying him to his place, but my sister did not agree and so she was kicked and she fell down.  There was a fight."

label: guilt
text: I failed to show up at an agreed date.

label: guilt
text: When I had beaten my auntie.

label: fear
text: "On my second plane trip, we ran into unexpected turbulence."

label: joy
text: I met a girlfriend again after not seeing her for several months.  I saw her in a discotheque.  We do not like discotheques but we went there because we knew we would meet there.

label: fear
text: Slept in a chapel and in the middle of the night I realized that there was someeone else in the chapel.  I never discovered who it was and why he was there.

label: anger
text: "When anybody wants to make me feel guilty. For example: I should do something for my mother, but things didn't go as she hoped. Then she threatens: I'll do it myself."

label: disgust
text: "A man tried to have sexual intercourse with me, though I had communicated my unwillingness.  Later on, I felt disgust at that person as well as myself because I had partly submitted."

label: disgust
text: A sour looking man was beating his thin dog in Remuera.

label: shame
text: When I was 13 years old I wrote passionate love letters to my boyfriend and I later found out that his sister had read them.

label: shame
text: When I had to prepare and read a paper to my fellow students but I didn't cope with the task.

label: guilt
text: Late for a lecture and therefore missed it.

label: disgust
text: "When I had exams a relative of ours, who lives in another city,came to visit us and I felt disgusted at him."

label: joy
text: When the whole family gets together for a one week holiday.  Everybody feels free and the trip is well planned.  It works out well and we enjoy ourselves.

label: anger
text: One day in a crossroad somebody crashed my car. I got out and this person laughed at me. I felt such a great anger that I got in my car and went away.

label: fear
text: When my neighbour's house was broken into and shots could be heard.

label: guilt
text: "I went to the cinema with my friends, without telling my mother about it as I had been to the cinema the day before also.  When she asked me where I had been, I lied."

label: shame
text: I told Mr Winter of Downtown Fashion to go to - when he did not accept my Visa !

label: fear
text: A terrible cloud-burst started when we were camping in a tent on a great bald field.

label: joy
text: Thought had discovered true love.

label: disgust
text: "When I learnt that my offer to study at the university had been withdrawn  and so I would not get hostel accomodation at UNZA, even though I registered as a student later."

label: disgust
text: In a sexual experience with an unknown woman where after the sexual act I only could go away without looking backwards.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgusted when I found out that someone had betrayed me. That person had been dishonest with me and I felt used.

label: sadness
text: There was a conflict of interest between me and a close friend of mine.  He only thought about his own interest and not about our friendship.  This behaviour hurt his friends.  Another incident is when a friend isolated himself without giving any reasons.

label: sadness
text: "When my grandmother died, her life was heavy and her last hours were terrible."

label: sadness
text: Saying goodbye to a friend.

label: anger
text: This situation happened when my friend John ate my banana which I kept in the cupboard.

label: anger
text: Some foreign students playing loud music before the biology examn.

label: anger
text: The juniors in our dormitory at school started to complain and make a lot of noise about the duties assigned to them by the prefect who was my class-mate and was very cool and dull.

label: disgust
text: Some students trying to please the lecturer.

label: disgust
text: When I found out some family friends were embezzelling the company they worked for - using company petrol and food supplies and claiming furniture and crockery.

label: anger
text: Discussion with my mother about the way to educate my children. I felt anger against my mother.

label: shame
text: I had always been first in my class and in the preliminary board exams I scored the highest marks.  Then the exams were postponed and I neglected my studies as I was confident.  However when the final results came out I felt ashamed as I had scored less than 60% marks and my rank in the class was fifth or sixth.

label: anger
text: Quarrelled with my younger brother.

label: fear
text: A dark night when I had to go to the outdoor lavatory.

label: joy
text: Meeting a loved man.

label: shame
text: When I was a child: I had told my mother a lie and she found it out.

label: anger
text: "My sister borrowed some LP records for a party. She had left them in the car on curatao. Due to the heat they were crooked, so I couldn't play them again."

label: anger
text: When a close relative is treated badly.

label: fear
text: We were driving on a very dusty road at night and the driver tried to overtake a very big truck only to find another big truck parked right in front.

label: joy
text: I was very pleased and happy when my older sister came home from living somewhere out of town and I hadn't seen her for months. We are very close sisters.

label: guilt
text: "Very often I take care for my little sister and oversee her duties. Most of the time everything went fine, but sometimes she absolutely didn't want to obey; then I hit her (we frequently were hit by our father)."

label: sadness
text: My boyfriend is a soldier. He was on a leave. I felt sad when we had to get separated again.

label: fear
text: First day back on the job.

label: anger
text: "I learned that a class-mate had given a list, of peolpe who help each other in exams, to the professor."

label: anger
text: Being insulted in public.

label: joy
text: Joy for me is when all my family gather around home for special occasions as Christmas etc. It really gives me joy to see my family and relatives and to observe natures productivity process which have been going on for centuries.

label: disgust
text: A person whom I thought to be honest took and spend the little money that I had and I had no way of getting any money in the few following months.

label: joy
text: Time had struck 8 o'clock when I heard from the radio that I had been selected to Robert Blake Secondary School for Form I. I was very happy for the selection. My parents and I were very happy and full of joy.

label: joy
text: "When I won the ""Under 18"" Showjumping at the Brookfield Show. The competition was very stiff and there were many riders competing."

label: anger
text: My friend and I were to attend a very important meeting and he had promised to come and pick me up.  But he did not turn up and I felt very angry at him.

label: sadness
text: I was sad to hear that my brother had a motorbike accident.

label: guilt
text: "Quite unconsciously I offended a girlfriend of mine. It was really worthy to pass this fact over in silence, but I acted so, because I believed I was right. In fact it often happens to me to feel guilt, after I have already done the deed."

label: sadness
text: Finding out that the girl I like does not like me.

label: sadness
text: The death of my mother-in-law after a long sick-bed. at the moment of dying I was with her.

label: disgust
text: "When I was still a child, I saw a horror film on TV in which there was a rotten human skull."

label: disgust
text: "Some people were unfairly treated, because of their nationality/colour."

label: shame
text: An exam where questions about very specific knowledge were asked.

label: fear
text: "I went to practice in Sweden during summer, and I was afraid that I would not do well."

label: shame
text: I was very angry at someone.

label: disgust
text: Saw people quarreling in a bus.

label: sadness
text: At an unjust insult or injure.

label: shame
text: When I had to walk home from the bus-stop in a skirt that I had soiled.  It drew a lot of attention and they all seemed to want to see the blood stains.

label: sadness
text: When I was in lower six class during the Summer I joined a research group of the Chinese university student union.  I knew a lot of CV students there.  A year later one of them was travelling in mainland China and he got T.B.  He died a few weeks after coming back to H.K.  We all got together for the funeral and when I looked at the body for the last time I felt extremely sad.

label: shame
text: I felt shame when I didn't study enough for my exams and as a result I failed. I then invented idle stories to talk it good for myself and the others.

label: sadness
text: "I arranged with a friend to go skating the next day. He asked me to wake him up by telephone at twelve o'clock because we had come home late in the morning. Next day I called him - he was not at home. As something like that had happened to me several times before, I came to the conclusion that one cannot rely on anybody and I felt very sad."

label: shame
text: "At primary school, when I vomited in front of others in the middle  of a lesson."

label: disgust
text: Negative statement concerning me of a friend before strangers.

label: joy
text: "I was selected to come here (University, College) when I was least expecting it."

label: joy
text: Receiving understanding from within self of a subject I had previously wished to understand better.

label: disgust
text: In cinema I saw a film which showed how a person was torn out his guts when he was still alive.

label: guilt
text: That I didn't want my friend to leave on holiday for 10 days because I thought I would miss him. I was constantly trying to persuade him.

label: guilt
text: Eating the last remains of dinner that someone else (unknown to me) had claimed.

label: disgust
text: It was a narrow and dirty passage which was located near the market and I had to stand there to wait for people.

label: sadness
text: "I felt very sad when I was in Form three to notice that my friend Barley Jumbe, had lost very expensive new sports short trousers."

label: sadness
text: When I caused much pain and sorrow to my boyfriend by finishing our relationship.

label: anger
text: Seeing this badly made questionnaire.

label: anger
text: When the bus driver failed to stop and pick me up at a bus stop.

label: guilt
text: "Two days after the above incident, I was thinking about my morally shameful act and I felt sorry for that incident, but it was too late, however I did realize this."

label: fear
text: Left alone in the dark in a big building.

label: shame
text: "During our last exarcise in agricultural machines we went out in the yard to examine a row of machines. But we seemed not to have fulfilled our task well, because when our teacher came and asked me a question I was unable to answer. I felt awkward because he didn't deserve it."

label: sadness
text: I had a girlfriend who lived several kilometers away from my home. One day she wrote me that she'd visit me. On her way she had a car accident and was badly injured. I was very sorry to see her lying in a bed in the hospital.

label: anger
text: "When I was doing research a few months ago, I had asked the Institute to sponsor me for a computer course which was held in TISS.  However, because of the administrative officer I could not get the money."

label: sadness
text: When I am at home alone.

label: joy
text: The first time I really fell in love with a girl.

label: guilt
text: I removed an article of clothing belonging to my employer while in a position of trust.

label: fear
text: Fear of thief.

label: disgust
text: People not cueing in the college dining room.

label: disgust
text: "I feel disgusted with toadies, hypocrites, chameleons."

label: anger
text: "When I wanted to talk to someone I liked and whom I have been told likes me (by his brother and even by himself) however he avoids any confrontation, and is vague."

label: fear
text: I was walking down a road and suddenly a few dogs appeared at a fence and started barking angrily.  They were jumping and it seemed that they would come for me any time.

label: joy
text: I experienced it when I was accepted at the Medical Higher Institute.

label: joy
text: "When I was accepted as a student at the college, not having thought it possible."

label: joy
text: Success in university entrance examination.

label: joy
text: When a cousin of mine was discharged from the hospital after       a long illness.  I had thought that this illness would never end.

label: anger
text: I was so angry with a patient who refused to take drugs.

label: shame
text: "While working as a domestic helper, one day I had not cleaned up very well and they made a remark about it."

label: disgust
text: "I felt disgust as a result of one of my midterms - I thought I had prepared well for it, but the end result wasn't what I had expected."

label: sadness
text: I experienced this when my maternal grandmother passed away.  She was the last of my grand parents to pass away.

label: joy
text: After several days delay in my girlfriend's menstration I was very glad to see that the pregnancy test was negative.

label: joy
text: Getting into this university to do medicine.

label: disgust
text: When somebody made me touch human faeces.

label: disgust
text: "Once when I had started to write a paper, there was a phone call for me.  I had to go downstairs to receive it and after the conversation I discovered that all the information had disappeared from my mind."

label: fear
text: "During the first year in university I had bad results in both the terms, especially the first term.  I was afraid that  I would not be promoted to the next year and that the others would go ahead of me."

label: fear
text: "On Christmas eve,1984, I had just finished the exams and was afraid as the results of one of my major subjects had been very unsatisfactory.  I thought that I had only a 50% chance of passing.  Even if I failed this subject I would not need to repeat.  However I liked this subject very much and my results were bad because of my lazyness.  If I was forced to change to a minor in this subject I would be very unwilling."

label: fear
text: "When going out in the weekend I have to bike 5 kilometers through lonely and dark polders, then I always have terrifying fantasies."

label: guilt
text: I kicked the chair in the classroom to express my anger.

label: sadness
text: When I was told that a good friend was seriously ill.

label: disgust
text: Finding out that old and useless practitioners of retirement age will go to your English lectures and they do not understand English.

label: joy
text: Being in love for the first time.

label: disgust
text: I was looking for an object when I came across a rotten corpse of a rat.

label: joy
text: The day I was happiest was the day when I received a phone call from Eve's Weekly to inform me that I had won the first prize of the All India Essay competition.  I had won this prize when I was an under-graduate when even post graduates had participated.  I had been judged by eminent judges and political scientists.

label: guilt
text: "At a party, several comments were made about the personal situation of one of the people present.  She was rather affected and uncomfortable."

label: guilt
text: Not being a good host for a friend from a far away place.

label: sadness
text: "I was terribly upset when my kitten got hit by a car. He didn't die, but for several weeks we thought he might have to be put down."

label: fear
text: I was watching a movie alone - it was a horror movie. The music was a deep pulsing type - not really music. And a light flashed on and off. It was in the complete darkness of a movie theatre that was almost empty.

label: sadness
text: When I came to know that a girl I was fond of already had a boyfriend.

label: anger
text: "I caught a ""peeping tom"" at my window when I was getting undressed."

label: shame
text: When an intimate friend of mine passed B.A with first class and I got only pass class.

label: joy
text: "When I heard that a good friend, who had been abroad for a long time, would come and see me."

label: shame
text: A month ago I turned in an English paper in late after I had already had a previous paper late and promised not to do it again.

label: shame
text: "When I had not prepared my contribution to the group as thoroughly as the other members, with the result that the overall result was poor."

label: guilt
text: Heard that my girl-friend was chosen for the English lectures and I was not. I lost my temper and she is very upset now.

label: joy
text: After much trouble getting together in the first place my boyfriend and I celebrated our first anniversary.

label: guilt
text: I used to pinch change from my father's mantlepiece (never my mother - she didn't get enough housekeeping) and then I'd feel when we went to church as a family I'd felt awkward cos I felt I'm expected to go to communion and I would but I was afraid and guilty 'cos I committed a mortal sin.

label: shame
text: "I had never made a malicious joke in front of my boyfriend. Last week I did it I was funny, he loved it, and I died of shame."

label: anger
text: "In the student's union there was someone who took the photocopies of two large volumes.  I asked him to let me take a few, he refused it for an acceptable reason. "

label: joy
text: I was filled with joy when I heard that I had been selected to come here at Kamuzu College of Nursing.

label: shame
text: One night I had a sexual intercourse with another man.  My sexual desire and my curiosity had made me jump into bed with him.  I am ashamed of myself now.

label: guilt
text: A friend wanted to give me a surprise into my room and I thought she was stealing from the room.

label: shame
text: A customer at the shop where I worked came in and asked if the goods that he had ordered had arrived.  I had totally forgotten about this order and I tried to offer weak excuses.

label: guilt
text: " In some special circumstances l lied to my parents, then felt guilty so I told them the truth and felt free."

label: anger
text: "I was angered by a classmate who poured soup on to my clothes. He was trying to use a short-cut method in getting his supper. Coming behind my back, he wasn't noticed by me and as I was retreating from a hungry congested people I knocked his plate with my head. He didn't accept being wrong but blamed me for pouring his soup."

label: guilt
text: "After a quarrel with my mother in which matters were ""inflated"" enormously."

label: guilt
text: My mother accused me of not visiting her enough when she was in hospital for an eye operation.

label: joy
text: "In 1980 when I was in the 12th standard, we had arranged a small picnic in Kandala.  One of my closest friends wrote a small and cute poem for me, which expressed the feeling of closeness we had for each other.  I was very thrilled and I can still remember it."

label: anger
text: I walked in on a teenage patient of mine (I work in a hospital) as he was going through my office drawers and he had removed money from my purse.

label: joy
text: Hear a very nice joke made by a friend.

label: guilt
text: "Had started a relationship and did nothing to keep it up, partly the use of another person."

label: shame
text: "I remember that once, a friend did not co-operate with me due to some unavoidable reasons.  Unaware of this I treated her unjustly till I realized everything, and then I felt ashamad of my deeds. "

label: shame
text: I told a lie about someone to someone else and they found out   and questioned me about it.

label: guilt
text: Eating too much I felt guilty afterwards because I knew I shouldn't have overeaten as I'm putting on too much weight.

label: guilt
text: "During class one day I walked out of the class.  The teacher noticed it and decided that he would take some action against me, when I realized this I approached him and told him that I was sorry for the incident and would not repeat it."

label: disgust
text: I have an adopted Aboriginal sister I felt disgust due to the racism she has been subjected to.

label: joy
text: "I was told quite unexpectedly that one wanted me to become the vice-chairman of our student organisation.  I was really surprised and joy was the first emotion I felt, though behind it there was worry - how shall I succeed ?"

label: anger
text: "I had been searching for housing for Fall at UCB and I was finally offered a place - then an ordeal followed, first I accepted then refused - related to my parents judgment (they're paying for me). Turns out that I was so upset at what my Dad said to me that I hung up on him. He called back and threatened to cut me off financially and emotionally."

label: joy
text: "I have a girlfriend, who is almost like a daughter to me.  She is studying out of station and I get to see her only once a year.  Her arrival is always a joyous one."

label: sadness
text: "When I applied for the college entrance examination to FUVEST, and I wasn't approved in the second fase."

label: joy
text: I was very happy when I found out that I had passed with flying colours and that I had made it to the university.

label: guilt
text: I experience feelings of guilt because I do not study enough.

label: guilt
text: When I had to lie about my age to be accepted as a member of a group.

label: sadness
text: "When I watched the T.V programme called ""The living planet"" and saw the far reaching environmental destruction caused by man."

label: disgust
text: When my grandmother came to stay with us permanently as she is a very difficult person to stay with and when she started telling false stories about us to other people.

label: sadness
text: "This condition accumulated in my mind when funeral news was brought to my awareness, that a close relative had passed away."

label: joy
text: Scoared a goal in a football match.

label: guilt
text: I was entrusted with an object and while using it I handled it carelessly and it broke.

label: fear
text: Stranded in the north of Fraser Island with a submerged 4 WD hire vehicle.

label: joy
text: One day I did not feel very well and I wanted to talk to somebody. A friend invited me for dinner and I was very glad.

label: fear
text: After some time of work I was transferred to another place and in an other quite harder job.

label: guilt
text: "I felt guilty because of the pain I caused to a very close friend. But over the feeling of guilt, my conviction of being right dominated."

label: sadness
text: "My grandmother died, and my mother called me one sunday morning in the Autumn.  The way my mother told me about it, I hated her at that moment.  She sounded as if she had been waiting for the death of my grandmother.  I had lost a person close to me.  I felt guilty too as I had been bad to my grandmother of late.  I had not remained calm when she no longer understood everything so well."

label: fear
text: I was very scared when I went to the examination hall for my M.Sc examination as I had studied a limited partion of the course thoroughly and I was in great doubt whether that would be asked.

label: fear
text: When I was told to attend an operation in theatre.

label: joy
text: When I won an unexpected sum of money.

label: disgust
text: "When I was watching a movie with many violent episodes.  They accurately showed the cutting of corpses, etc..."

label: shame
text: "When I was little and didn't own up to placing a lolly on the varnish, this pulled it all off and I didn't admit my guilt."

label: anger
text: I felt angry when my only pair of trousers was stolen and could not be able to find out who the thief was or anyone who knew about the story.

label: anger
text: When I was accused of having refused to do some hostel work while I was at school.  Actually I had not been allocated any work.

label: disgust
text: "Once when I was studying for my examination, I was asked to do some work which was unavoidable."

label: disgust
text: Some time ago a girl tried to make me up without any action of my part. She used all possible means. Although I behaved refusingly she did not give up for a longer time.

label: guilt
text: "I let my pet budgie loose to fly around my room one afternoon. A few hours afterwards I found he was still free, went in and out of my room leaving the door open. My cat got in and killed my budgie - this happened to 3 budgies."

label: joy
text: "Inter-national sports events won by my favourite national team or player brings me joy, e.g when India won the World cup cricket match."

label: joy
text: "When I achieved my first 6 at University after a long string of 3's, 4's and 5's (7 is the highest mark awarded, 3 is a conceded pass)."

label: anger
text: When I saw that my bed at the hostel was a mess I guessed that someone else had used my daily necessities.  I felt that my  personal sanity had been affected.

label: disgust
text: When my roommate and I had dinner together we decided as to who would clean the bowls.  One day when I came back from school I found that she had not cleaned up.  Since I had to cook dinner I cleaned them myself and felt unhappy and disgusted.

label: fear
text: When I found out that my father had lung cancer and they did not know how long he would live.

label: fear
text: A relative died.

label: joy
text: Falling in love.

label: fear
text: "When I was travelling by tram, I tripped and fell against the door.  I thought that I was going to fall out."

label: joy
text: When I passed a very important exam.

label: shame
text: I put my head into the pullover of a girl to see her breasts. The girl looked at me so that I felt ashamed.

label: disgust
text: "A friend's boy-friend treated her very badly, let her serve him, provoked her and just utilized her."

label: fear
text: Thinking that I had been seen smoking at school by a teacher - waiting to be summoned to the headmaster's office.

label: sadness
text: "My sweatheart were away on a trip, and then she got problems."

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty one day when I stole a slice of bread in a cafeteria.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilt to have come back from home without seeing my father. When I went home he was at work.

label: sadness
text: Sometimes I experience sadness for the Sports High School and for my unrealized dreams in the sport. Anyway there I spent six years of my life.

label: fear
text: Before important sports events.

label: fear
text: "Just arrived in the university, not knowing anybody."

label: anger
text: "Following an argument with my brother, he broke my golf clubs."

label: shame
text: "I had to meet a girlfriend to go out for a drink and she arrived with her aunt, to whom I was introduced.  Then the aunt left."

label: disgust
text: "I was disgusted at myself when I dropped a vital catch, while playing a cricket match, and we lost the match; though the catch was difficult. "

label: disgust
text: When a boy I hated most in our classroom took my T Jersey from my desk and put it on.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilt towards my mother when I went to live on rooms in Nijmegen where I study.

label: guilt
text: I was very angry with a girlfriend for interferring a little too much with my personal affairs. I told her so rather strongly and she started crying.

label: shame
text: When I told a lie to a friend of my sister on April fool's day.  She later came to see me and told me that it was a very foolish thing to do.

label: anger
text: I was angry when somebody stole my half petticoat.

label: disgust
text: I applied for a job of GALSO counselor and I made the strongest possible application but was denied an interview. I felt disgusted at the system which by promoting the cause of minorities makes employing whites lowest priority.

label: fear
text: It was on St. Claus Day when I was five years old. St. Claus and his Devil Servant came to see me. St. Claus' Devil Servant rattled with his chain and bowled terribly. I was so frightened that my parents had to ask him to leave.

label: sadness
text: I remember that when my mother died the day was sad and every time I think of it I am saddened by the loss of my mother.

label: shame
text: During a lecture six students (including me) were asked to leave the class as we had not prepared for the lesson.  I felt ashamed and angry.

label: shame
text: I feel ashamed every time that someone makes me a positive or negative critic.

label: joy
text: When my boyfriend and I made up.

label: sadness
text: "Recent break-up of seriors long-term relationship, helped along by would-be  in-laws."

label: joy
text: "When, after a long time, I saw a girl with whom I was in love."

label: sadness
text: When the result of a project work was treated nonchalantly intead of being criticized by the teacher.

label: joy
text: That afternoon I rushed home to look at the result slip of the higher level as fast as possible.  I opened the envelope very carefully and found that my results were much better than I had expected and thus I could enter the Chinese university.  My diligence had paid and I was very happy.

label: guilt
text: My son drank four pills of diazepam every two hours instead of amidophen.

label: anger
text: "Seeing for the first time pictures about the so called ""treatment"" of Jewish people in Nazi-Germany during World War II."

label: guilt
text: I forgot my mother's and sister's birthdays (they fall on the same day).

label: joy
text: "After a long time (of no communication with him, physical illness and worry) my lover came to see me, when I least expected to see him."

label: sadness
text: "When I learnt that I had failed an exam,  This not only influenced my emotions but also other important tasks, it also made my record imperfect."

label: fear
text: "When I came back from work one day, the friends of my son told me that he had not come back from school and that he was lost."

label: joy
text: "When I saw a friend of mine, whom I had not seen for a long time and I had lost his address and telephone number."

label: disgust
text: "When someone whom I trusted, disappointed me terribly."

label: sadness
text: When I learned that two of my friends had had a serious car accident.

label: sadness
text: When my mother and father were on an excursion in Chechoslovakia and I was at a student camp and I heard over the radio about the events that were taking place there.

label: disgust
text: At a party I saw two persons having a fight. The aggressions and the hate between these persons produced an unpleasant impression on me.

label: disgust
text: My flatmate and close friend living and sleeping with another close friend of mine.

label: disgust
text: I was stopped from entering a party while I was at School but I had an Invitation card with me. This was done because they said I was too young to join elderly people.

label: anger
text: An argument among friends in which my opinions on the way to spend spare time were disapproved.

label: anger
text: Anger with boyfriend's best friend for alienating me and blaming me for personality changes in my boyfriend and changes in my boyfriend's attitude to him and his obvious egoistical attitude himself in doing so. I also lost one of my best friends - his girlfriend.

label: anger
text: "When a professor of this faculty laughed at, and was suspicious of a composition written by a class-mate and me."

label: guilt
text: I got up late and I could not go to my lessons on time.  When I entered the class room the stare of the teacher and my classmates made me feel guilty.

label: disgust
text: When my relatives troubled me so that I would help them financially.

label: sadness
text: When I was a child I was playing on the upper deck of the bed with my brother.  My parents slept on the lower deck.  My father felt disgusted and beat me up.  I felt very sad as my father had never beaten me or scolded me before.

label: fear
text: When a thief entered the house in which I was sleeping.

label: fear
text: "In a cottage in a large forest, I was alone for a while in the dark."

label: anger
text: When the person I'm having the affair with won't talk to me in public.

label: guilt
text: "Once, I accidentally injured a boy in the eye and he almost lost it."

label: sadness
text: "My father resigned from work, and soon after this his elder brother died.  The next day my granny died (my mother's mother).  My dad remains the only living member of his family."

label: sadness
text: When I think about my parents getting old.

label: fear
text: When I had to talk with an important person about a job.

label: sadness
text: My son lives in the country. I feel sadness when I see mothers having walks with their children.

label: disgust
text: "My first day to work in hospital, when I was dressing wounds I was disgusted when I came across one wound with a very bad smell."

label: anger
text: When friends try to put me down or hurt me.

label: sadness
text: The passing away of my mum.

label: disgust
text: Some boys not cueing in the dining hall.

label: sadness
text: When a pet died. The pet was the closest friend I had for 15 years.

label: shame
text: "I was very fat, and was ashamed of my body."

label: joy
text: "When two female classmates and I were having lunch, we chatted and  cracked jokes, I was very happy.  However, I felt that I may have  said something inappropriate which might cause them to have a bad  impression of me."

label: fear
text: One night I had to bike home all alone after a party. Then I found out that I was pursued by a man in a car.

label: fear
text: In a flat in Sydney - rough area at home on my own - the flat had been burgled the night before and no way of locking the door.

label: joy
text: "When I passed my driving test, as it was the fifth time that I had taken this test."

label: fear
text: I felt afraid of losing somebody I love to another person because I was an incomprehensive person and lots of time I fight with this person.

label: joy
text: Last Summer I achieved someting that I had been wanting for a long time.

label: disgust
text: "A drunkard fell, started bleeding and wet himself.  Disgust that turned into sadness-unpleasantness."

label: shame
text: "I insulted a couple of good friends of mine and even tried to hit them when I was drunk.  The next day, I was ashamed of course."

label: fear
text: "I was testing my new roller skates in the street, suddenly a dog ran barking in my direction, very threatening. I was very startled and terribly upset."

label: guilt
text: "When my sister had the opportunity to do some modelling work. And I was quite jealous - later on the photographer decided not to take her photograph, and she was very upset - I felt guilty as a result, almost as if I had caused her to lose her opportunity, by not being genuinely happy for her in the first place."

label: disgust
text: When I see someone vomitting.

label: guilt
text: I got back too late after a Sunday going out without having called up home to tell where I was. my mother hadn't slept the whole night.

label: anger
text: I am usually angry at myself. This happens often. For instace when I want to pet without falling in love and it soon proves that I have fallen in love with him.

label: disgust
text: When I saw President Reagan get elected.

label: sadness
text: When my father was ill.

label: anger
text: I sent a book to a friend of mine.  The book meant a lot to me and he lost it.

label: anger
text: "When my father did not get back from Chipata on time, he was thus holding back progress as everything depended on him.  I felt angry over his actions."

label: shame
text: When I asked a friend to return the money that I had loaned her and then remembered that she had repayed me in several ways.

label: shame
text: "When I made the same mistake that I had accused someone else of, and this was obvious to a third pereson."

label: sadness
text: When my dog died.  I had reared it for nearly three years.  It had been ill for several days and had not eaten anything.  One morning I found it dead.

label: fear
text: When I thought the house was on fire at night.

label: shame
text: When I failed the grade seven exams.

label: fear
text: When I was cycling past a parked car someone opened the door and nearly pushed me off my bike and into the traffic.

label: fear
text: When I learnt that the girl I had impregnated was in hospital and was on the verge of dying as she had refused to accept the responsibility of her pregnancy and had wanted to commit suicide.

label: fear
text: "On a trip to Santander we wanted to stop at a curve because a friend was sick, and the car skidded of the gravel."

label: shame
text: When I let my girlfriend use my essay to help her to write hers and the tutor found them alike.

label: fear
text: I was within a hair's breadth of knocking down a drunkard who suddenly ran into the street.  The fear came later when I     realized what could have happened.

label: joy
text: "I sensed such a feeling when I understood I was admitted to the University. I was at home, the atmosphere was still, though I myself was full of suspense. I tried to do different things. When the telephone rang and...! Yes, of course there were other situations when I felt a similar feeling but I was unmindful of them."

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty about going out when I should have been studying for a presentation I had to give on Wednesday the next week.

label: anger
text: "I get angry with people who attain certain status without deserving it, only with the support, authority and influence of other people."

label: joy
text: When I was accepted for my third year (G-10) at my former secondary school.

label: shame
text: I put an end to a friendship with a girl - I had only pretended love and affection to be able to sleep with her.

label: shame
text: I made a comment that at the moment didn't fit.

label: anger
text: "One day my elder brother badly scolded my father.  This was the first time that I heard such abusive language from my brother.  I requested him humbly not to use this kind of language but he did not care for what I was saying.  Finally I picked up an axe to use against him, in the meanwhile people intervened."

label: guilt
text: I cheated my boyfriend.

label: joy
text: "I was feeling really low - had been a series of fights with my siblings, been under pressure at school and wasn't going to the party I wanted to go - instead I was going out with my family. A guy called and said, in effect, that I was ""nice"" and he liked me. Hence the emotional joy."

label: disgust
text: When I had just moved into my new appartment I found a ventilator in the kitchen.  I was going to clean it when I found that the drum was full of mud and slime.  I felt disgusted.

label: joy
text: One of my friends and I had breakfast in a restaurant. It was spontaneous and lots of fun.

label: joy
text: "A sunny Autumn day, after a long rainy period."

label: anger
text: The breakup of a relationship. After the event I was upset/sad then angry maybe 2/3 weeks later.

label: anger
text: "At a school dance when my supposed ""best friend"" kept walking away from me whenever I came near her."

label: anger
text: They had returned much less of my taxes than I had expected.

label: joy
text: My sister and brother in law returned from Sri Lanka where they adopted a child. I went to pick them up at the airport.

label: disgust
text: "While watching a movie, someone who was drunk started vomiting helplessly."

label: fear
text: "When I saw the movie ""Poltergist""."

label: fear
text: Earth crake.

label: joy
text: Scoring a goal in football match.

label: shame
text: "I stayed at home for a period because I felt depressive and I neglected my study when people adked me, I told them that I had freeterm and studied hard. I felt ashamed for my behavior and lies."

label: shame
text: Breaking an implicit promise.

label: shame
text: "Once by coincidence I clutched a stranger (in a rather intimate way), thinking it was my boyfriend. When by hindsight I feel ashamed when thinking about it."

label: disgust
text: "Eco-activists demonstrated against a project to build a power station at the Danube in the middle of a lowland forest (Hainburg) and the government decided to delay it for another year. When my father heard about it, he said that we needed another Hitler."

label: shame
text: "When I was 6 or 7 years old, I pulled down the trousers of a friend because I wanted to know what she looked like. My mother watched that and (as a punishment) sent me into the house. We never spoke about that; I think it was as embarassing for her as it was for me. "

label: fear
text: When I slept for the first time all alone in the house where I live now. A man phoned me at 2.00 am. He wanted something from me. I was afraid.

label: shame
text: Spots on the seat covers of my husband's car.

label: disgust
text: "This happened when I could not get into the school I had initially wanted, and ended up doing something I had never thought I would do."

label: sadness
text: When my girl went away for a holiday without saying good-bye to me.

label: shame
text: Our teacher had invited us to lunch and once at the canteen we started introducing ourselves.  Two of the boys showed a lot of interest in knowing personal details and then they started talking about some activities held in the college.  I had little interest in those activities so I talked to another student sitting next to me as I was afraid that they would ask me questions on those activities.

label: joy
text: When my love for a guy was returned.

label: joy
text: When my present boyfriend asked me initially to go out with him I had waited a long time for this to occur.

label: shame
text: Not finishing my duty as a class leader.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgust toward meat when I felt sick with the steak after a week only on meat.

label: disgust
text: "There is a certain person, whom I only have seen. He makes me cringe, feel disgust."

label: guilt
text: When I was a kid I stole toys from other kids.

label: shame
text: My father insulted by other people.

label: anger
text: The mother of a person with whom we had been sharing a housing accused me of trying to rip her off over payment of bills in the house.

label: disgust
text: "When working in a chemical laundry, I saw rats and maggots in the washing."

label: joy
text: "When my special friend said ""I love you"" for the first time."

label: fear
text: Obscene phone call where the person knew my name.

label: sadness
text: Cooks refused to give me food.

label: disgust
text: "When we were young, a friend of mine tried to dissect a frog while  we were playing near his home."

label: shame
text: "My sister said I am not a stable person, and I think she is right."

label: fear
text: "While tramping on a narrow path two of us were confronted by a woman with two snarling dogs, demanding we get off the property - via a flooded river !"

label: disgust
text: Slaughtering of animals.

label: shame
text: When I failed my grade 7 exam at the first attempt in 1975.  My father and the entire family thought that I was finished in life.  I really felt like hiding.

label: fear
text: A few weeks back I had a very important seminar and I had circulated my papers to all the panel members.  A day before the seminar I realized that I had inadvertantly burdened certain       derivations and I had failed to correct it.  I feared that this    would reflect very badly on my performance.  Fortunately none of  the panel members detected it and I felt relieved.

label: anger
text: Anger towards my lover for being late.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty of revealing a secret to my in-law. I told her that my brother and I had gone to disconight which is a thing my brother didn't want to let her know. Later my brother was accused of spending a night out.

label: fear
text: "Fear is an emotion that I experience very often.  Naturally this is during exams and subsequently while waiting for the results.  However there is one occassion when I was paralyzed with fear.  This was when I was doing my M.A.-I, and we had a series of student lectures.  I was one of the participants and my lecture happened to be the opening lecture.  I had been confident all morning, about twenty minutes before the lecture, my confidence started failing me.  I felt my heart go cold, my lips go dry and I was really paralyzed.  This incident of fear is still fresh."

label: guilt
text: A sense of guilt before my parents when I had to discountinue my studies in the first year because of unpassed exams.

label: guilt
text: A friend of mine said in a group that she felt lonely and withdrawn from everyone because of mental deficiency.

label: anger
text: "Being subject to unfair treatment in a working group, someone ""bending the rules"" was protected by the boss. This resulted in more work for the others."

label: disgust
text: When I was on holiday someone vomited in front of me.

label: shame
text: "I felt something akin to shame after a heavy night of drinking, along with waking up with a woman I had just met whose husband was an epileptic. I was later to know that she knew my mother."

label: guilt
text: Forgot to give a present to my little nephew.

label: sadness
text: I saw a lot of starving people in a T.V news report.

label: sadness
text: When realizing that my girlfriend and myself in fact had started the process of breaking up.

label: guilt
text: I knew I had to take an exam very soon but yet I couldn't start studying. I also knew it was very imprtant to succeed the exam this time.

label: joy
text: "When I received the letter informing that I had been accepted to be a Chinese university student, I was excited as I had longed for it."

label: guilt
text: My father had been alone for a long time because my mother and sister were on holiday. I had not seen him for a long time and when I finally called him I realized that he had been very sad about that.

label: joy
text: "I was captain of the school swimming team. The team was only two points in front before the last relay. We won the relay, which I swam in, and thus my team won the championship."

label: joy
text: Spontaneous picnic with sister and friend and children - great.

label: joy
text: Having received an offer to do post-graduate work.

label: shame
text: When I went to explain to a lecturer whom I liked that the work expected of me was not going to be in.

label: disgust
text: A brother from one of the Christian fellowship often phoned me and talked to me for half an hour or more.  However there was nothing important in the conversation and I found the person very disgusting.

label: joy
text: I was studying in the library and a class-mate told me that she had obtained a grant to work in the library.

label: shame
text: Not collecting homeworks in time to give the teacher.

label: shame
text: "One rainy day when the streets were wet, and as I was walking down a slope, I fell down out of my carelessness.  There were many people and they saw me, so I felt ashamesd.  Moreover I hurt my ankle and it was painful."

label: joy
text: I was very happy when my scholarship to continue studying at UNZA was approved after it had been cancelled.

label: anger
text: My best friend at school told lies about me to a boy I was seeing and went out with him herself.

label: disgust
text: In secondary school I had a class-mate who talked too much.   Once we went to the cinema after school and she sat next to me and commented the movie throughout  - very disgusting.

label: disgust
text: When I got to know the details if the famine in East Africa.

label: fear
text: "I was in a train where a fight occurred. One person who was there opened his handbag and took out a gun, another who fought too looked among his things for a weapon to fight."

label: disgust
text: At the butcher's I saw an animal which had just been slaughtered; blood was dripping on the floor.

label: disgust
text: When I got indecent offers.

label: sadness
text: I had a quarrel with a good friend about the fact that I didn't pay her a visit when she expected me to come. Hereafter I was very sad because it became a real quarrel.

label: joy
text: After 10 days of hard work and having suffered many changes I passed my last exam.

label: sadness
text: I was driving near my girlfriend's house and I decided to keep going because it was late and I would be back in the next few days anyway. The next day she was killed in a road accident.

label: disgust
text: Close friends talking badly of other friends.

label: joy
text: Being asked to go out by someone I care.

label: sadness
text: "1976, Soweto uprising in South Africa and the racist Gout's reaction to the students demands concerning the educational system."

label: fear
text: When I saw a horrible movie - Alien.

label: fear
text: Doing anatomy alone for the first time.

label: joy
text: A party I went to last Christmas.

label: sadness
text: When my mum's brother passed away after having been involved in a car accident.   He was bringing me a present as I had passed my form five exams with flying colours.

label: guilt
text: Telling friends about your nickname.

label: disgust
text: A situation where I ignored my beliefs and principles for a trip of whimsy.

label: shame
text: I slipped and fell in to a puddle and people started looking at me.

label: anger
text: I reachad home to find that my baby had not been bathed and fed.

label: joy
text: "I was on holidays, and I was going to meet a friend whom I had not seen for six months.  Again I felt very happy."

label: joy
text: "When I saw my brother in Church, and publically accept Jesus Christ as his saviour and Lord."

label: anger
text: I was angry with a person who behaved terribly at a ball offending her relatives.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgusted on seeing my boyfriend after our separation.  One day he was begging at the mass transit railway station and at that moment I hated him.

label: fear
text: "Motorcyclistic accident where for some minutes I didn't know if I was alive or dead, I remained ""cold levered"" during the situation but felt great fear."

label: shame
text: A girl asked me why I didn't dance. I told her I was ashamed to dance. I felt myself ashamed having to tell her this.

label: joy
text: Getting the top price in the football pools.

label: anger
text: "A friend of mine uses butter instead of oil when he is cooking. I am always angry about that, because it is an unnecessary luxury. Recently we both were cooking and he wanted to use butter again. When I had already put the oil into the pan, he poured it out again and put the butter into the pan."

label: fear
text: When I have to go in for an exam and the examinor is a person with a whimsical character and unsteady requirements.

label: disgust
text: When I see people who have no sentiments.

label: anger
text: After a long trip in my dad's van without incident I stopped to fill the tank with gas and dented the side of the van against the pole. Then my cars electrical system would not work when I tried to drive home from his house.

label: fear
text: When someone tried to bewitch me and my friends at night.

label: shame
text: When I failed grade 7.

label: fear
text: Once while crossing a road I was overcome with fear.

label: shame
text: "The day my boyfriend saw and touched my breasts when I was without my shirt, only with my pants."

label: shame
text: Watching Muldoon act as my P.M.

label: guilt
text: I told my parents (or more realistically) would not do what they wanted me to do anymore. I guess I sort of betrayed them after all they had done for me.

label: disgust
text: Watching an alcoholic woman who was approaching everyone at the wharf for cigarettes - a prostitute in Auckland (elderly).

label: joy
text: When my wife gave birth to a baby boy - my only son to date.

label: fear
text: "My friend started to misunderstand and hurt me.

label: guilt
text: When I discovered that the girl I was courting was a relative of mine.

label: shame
text: I was dancing in a theatre.  I was not sure whether some frieends of mine had come to see me.  I was very scared of doing things wrong.

label: sadness
text: "I had been living in an overseas city and made the decision to leave the city and come home about 12 months before I met a whole new set of friends, leaving them at the airport was sad and traumatic as they had helped me in many ways and I knew I wouldn't see many of them again."

label: fear
text: I went home late one evening and saw that the security lights were off.  I got inside the gate and just then I realized that the dogs may be outside.

label: anger
text: When I first saw a person begging.

label: fear
text: I felt fear some months ago of losing the person whom I loved when she said to me that she didn't love me.

label: sadness
text: My parents failed to visit me as they promised.

label: joy
text: "Two years ago, somebody I like very much wanted to give up his studies. I tried to make him understand the importance of what he was going to do, not only of the difficulty to find a job but also because he will decrease his culture etc. This person made the test to the college entrance examination and to our great joy we found out that he succeded in entering at the University."

label: disgust
text: Hearing of a filthy situation over the phone.

label: joy
text: When I gave birth to my son and saw that he was alive and that I had managed it well.  He was born a month too early with a malfunctioning lung.  This happened a year ago.

label: sadness
text: I was very sad when my first boyfriend finished our relationship.

label: guilt
text: "I had to take care of the plants of a friend of mine for several weeks. I watered them, but let them stand in a cold room so that two of them perished."

label: joy
text: "When last year in college I received the award ""Best Student of the Year"",   I felt very happy as I got what I had wanted and my wish had been fulfilled."

label: sadness
text: "I have once been very sad and lonely.  This was when I was trying to organize a play as a student (15 years).  Instead of materializing, it fizzled out.  The worst thing was that the play fell apart completely and I found myself weeping uncontrollably.  Now when I think of it, I laugh it off; but at that time it was intense."

label: shame
text: "A situation where we were the center of attention, and things happened without my control on them, that showed our disagreement, and ignorance."

label: guilt
text: Lack of respect for my parents.

label: joy
text: I phoned a friend of mine to ask her for news about the marks in an exam.  She told me that I had passed.

label: shame
text: Telling friends about how my parents had been treating my brothers and sisters unfairly.

label: shame
text: "I feared that I would have to describe my sexual life to an older, strange woman."

label: disgust
text: Encouter with a prostitute.

label: sadness
text: This morning during my sleep I had a feeling that someboby was attacking me.  I started crying in my sleep and then my room-mate woke me up.

label: fear
text: I was on a trip to Phillipines during Summer and I was staying in a hotel.  The room I was staying in was very silent and had very dim lights.  The last night I felt frightened and lay awake - I could hear some sounds around me and dared not open my eyes - I waited for dawn.

label: sadness
text: My cat was sick and I had to take him to the vet to be put down - no one else there to do it.

label: joy
text: "The weekend after I argued with my parents I went home again and they couldn't have been nicer. As soon as I walked in, Mum kissed me, then Dad, and thanked me for the birthday presents I'd left for him, including a very sentimental birthday card."

label: sadness
text: When a close friend of mine who was with me in first year could not make it to the second year.

label: fear
text: I was moving in the graveyard at 6.00 pm one day and was griped by fear because I was told that ghosts detain people moving there at night.

label: fear
text: When someone close to me is travelling by car and is delayed.

label: sadness
text: "The thought that I'll never sit at the school desk again, caused a deep grief at the end of my eleventh form."

label: shame
text: I was ashamed when a certain friend of mine I used to move with failed to propose to a lady yet we always said to ourselves no lady can refuse our proposal.

label: guilt
text: "I felt guilty when I said bad things to my sister, I had not intended to do so.  She cried a lot and later she fell ill and I felt responsible for her illness."

label: joy
text: "In the army, my result at the shooting exercises got me a three day furlough."

label: shame
text: "When I lied to my girlfriend, telling her that I had passed an exam, when I actually did not even take it."

label: sadness
text: "A very close friend from Victoria visited me over the holidays. Having enjoyed his company immensely over 10 short days, I was overwhelmed by sadness when he left to return to Victoria."

label: fear
text: "When I had left my home, my father, under false pretences, got me in his car and drove home where we were all alone. He was seethed with rage because I withrew from his authority. He hit me, kicked me and threatened me."

label: anger
text: A father helping his kid to fight other kids.

label: anger
text: After a hard day at the university I also had to make dinner that evening. It failed because of a frying pan which broke.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted when my little sister had been hit badly by her friends.

label: fear
text: When I almost drowned myself in the municipal swimming pool that I use to go almost not excaping.

label: sadness
text: "My sister was in a hospital, later in the evening we received the information that she had died."

label: disgust
text: When I failed the entrance exam of the medical school and was studying biochemistry which has no job prospects in Zambia.

label: fear
text: After mischieviously ringing on the chemist's trade-entrance doorbell and getting caught by him.

label: anger
text: "I was angry when my sister began to talk nonsense and to laugh at the way I swept the room.  My anger grew (I tried to control myself).  After telling her to leave me alone, I vented my anger on her as she did not obey me."

label: guilt
text: "After an exam I was in a very bad mood as I had done it very       badly.  At home, my mother took so long to ask me how things had  gone that I lost my temper.  I overreacted and made my mother cry. She still prepared lunch for me and did not scold me .  Suddenly, I thought that it was my fault and I started crying.  "

label: sadness
text: A friend of mine could not make it back to Unza after having failed the exams.

label: anger
text: Someone drove into my car and then denied that it had happened.

label: anger
text: "When I was blamed for some of my attributes which are very often misunderstood, especially when one is very frank."

label: anger
text: I felt anger at my roommate due to his habit of leaving dirty dishes in the sink and generally not cleaning after himself.

label: disgust
text: The same as in SHAME.

label: sadness
text: Death of grandmother.

label: fear
text: "Skiing down a very icy slope, very fast in white-out conditions. Out of control with no idea of what I was doing or where I was heading."

label: shame
text: Some weeks ago I experienced a day that everything went wrong I broke several things I felt very ashamed for I am not a sloven.

label: guilt
text: "When ,due to hunger and tiredness, I became generally irritated with my fiancee and made cutting remarks which really hurt him.  Later I realized that my unfounded irritation had hurt the person I love most on earth."

label: guilt
text: When I was a child I often quarrelled with my younger sister. Once I became so angry that I slapped her in the face. She cried and shouted so that my mother came in and scolded me.

label: anger
text: "When I was forced to call the telephone company about a bill concerning a disconnected phone belonging to my landlord.  The bill was four months overdue and in the meanwhile he had been using my phone, he seemed to have no intention of having his own phone reconnected."

label: disgust
text: I read a newspaper report that a little boy was forced to look while his sister was raped.

label: disgust
text: I was working in a classmate's house with a group. A girl began to graze her foot against mine under the table.

label: disgust
text: The sadistinc exacution of a student in the USA.

label: disgust
text: "When I was getting up, I found a live cockroach in my bedroom."

label: disgust
text: When I read a newspaper article on a young girl who had been raped and assaulted one night by several men when she was unconscious.

label: joy
text: I felt joy when my two twin sisters were born.

label: guilt
text: During a discussion I reacted very aggressively and so I made it impossible to continue discussing.

label: disgust
text: "People who came to our home - and requested ""Put out your smoke"". That we should not smoke in our house... and asked not even politely. It disgusted me because I think people need to adapt to the situation."

label: anger
text: "During the Summer, at my workplace, a person kept interfering with my tasks and making unfounded remarks.  I felt hatred for him but it stopped when I realized that he just longed for attention."

label: sadness
text: A friend of mine told me that my boyfriend had been with another girl this Summer.  We had been going out together for four years and we had not done so for the last three months.  I could not believe it.

label: disgust
text: A girl I do not like kept coming to me and talking to me.

label: sadness
text: I was forced to leave an unforgettable friend.

label: sadness
text: "Upon moving away from home for the first time to a different city, I felt no longer ""under the wing"" of my parents even though they would always be there to help me. I felt a sense of loss, I was now all alone in the world, responsible for my own actions."

label: shame
text: During an argument an acquaintance accused me of having insulted her parents by having had sex in their house which they overheard.

label: sadness
text: When I found my baby whipped by my Auntie. I was really sad and up to this moment my sadness is still on.

label: guilt
text: Not handing in homework in time.

label: sadness
text: Sadness - this is an emotion which I have felt very often recently. I can't remember a concrete example. I will describe my general impression from severl situations which evoked this feeling in me.

label: shame
text: When I was taken to the place where my uncle had defecated in his pants after having drunk beer.

label: disgust
text: When I was a young teenager (14)  my brother-in-law to be had made heavy advances to me.  I did not understand very well what it was all about but I reacted strongly and the feelings are still there.

label: disgust
text: A drunk walked out in front of a car at night. Both lower legs were broken. His shoe was thrown about 50 yards after the accident.

label: shame
text: "While watching a religious film, I got very excited and made a number of comments which were reproached to me by an elderly person who respected me."

label: shame
text: "When I as a Pakeha (white) new Zealander, was just as racially prejudiced as other people whom I had condemned."

label: fear
text: "Before Uni started, I had to leave home and take up residence in Brisbane (the ""big smoke"") leaving home, my family, and moving to such a big place was quite intimidating at first, and I was anxious about it."

label: disgust
text: "I had a discussion with my wife about an over-weight acquaintance of our's, about her eating habits and the scars caused by her pregnancy."

label: anger
text: Insulted by some stupid people.

label: sadness
text: I was selected to do a rest for a foreign ballet but I did not have the money to do it.

label: joy
text: When I was told that I could take a week off and go for a trip with my friends.

label: sadness
text: When my cousin passed away.

label: shame
text: I felt shame when I had to talk with a person that I hadn't seen for many years. Shame that he wouldn't recognize me or that I wouldn't know what to say.

label: guilt
text: When I had wrongly explained someone an important exemple for an examination.

label: guilt
text: When I was involved in a car crash.

label: sadness
text: Guy I cared for went back to Canada to live.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty last year during the winter term exams. A colleague of mine asked me to give him my lecture notes (I had very good notes and I had passed my exam in advance) but I still don't know why I didn't give them to him. That colleague failed and he was on the verge of not passing it at the supplementary examinations.

label: fear
text: I had to tell someone that I was interested in remaining celibate and alone. And that my spiritual master strictly prohibited sexual relations outside of marriage. This caused great fear through lack of conviction afraid to hurt someone's feelings despite my own being hurt in the process.

label: anger
text: Without the employer's knowledge and even without any communication their bank accounts were changed and their personal accounts closed.

label: fear
text: When I was bringing in the shopping and nearly stood on a snake.

label: anger
text: When students in our working group showed no responsibility or interest in our work.

label: guilt
text: "While having an argument with my daughter, I got angry and over-excited and said angry words."

label: joy
text: When I look at people around and know that people who are stupid look stupid.

label: disgust
text: "A girlfriend of mine behaves in a very childish way - she does not like my going to see a friend who has been introduced to me by this same friend of mine.  I would like to be friends with both of them, but she does not like this as she is possessive and would like me to be close only to her."

label: shame
text: After an event in which I felt that I had acted unfairly.

label: fear
text: "My husband had gone to drive a strange, broken car.  At the agreed time, he had not returned, and I feared that he had had an accident."

label: sadness
text: "During the funeral of my grandmother, when I saw my mother and other family members crying."

label: guilt
text: Getting a friend an open container ticket because I got caught speeding.

label: shame
text: "I was in my room, I just heard that my Uncle had been caught in somebody's house with somebody's wife. He had to appear in court. I went to see what would happen to him."

label: disgust
text: "Doctors ignored relative who complained about pain, and is now dying of cancer."

label: joy
text: I met my present boyfriend on a boat trip to England.  We had said that we would call each other when we got back to Sweden (we were not going to the same town in England).  As soon as I walked in he called from England as he could not wait till he came home.

label: fear
text: "I was working at a certain place and everyday after work dad would come to pick me up.  One day he did not come, it started getting very dark and I had no money on me and my home was very, very far away."

label: fear
text: English papers are due on Friday. They are returned on Tuesday. This Tuesday I was afraid to go to class and get my paper because I knew it was bad.

label: shame
text: Not being able to hand in homework in time.

label: guilt
text: I stole a coconut cake from a reception table and when I put in my mouth I realized that the host was watching me.

label: guilt
text: "I was of the opinion that 12.00 pm was too early to be back at home after going out, so I stayed away longer, knowing that my mother would be worried."

label: guilt
text: I had lunch with my ex-boyfriend and did not mention it to my fiancee.  I felt guilty despite the fact that I felt nothing for my ex-boyfriend.

label: guilt
text: When my boyfriend asked me to go out with him and I refused because I wanted to go out with another guy.  I did go out and my boyfriend found out.

label: anger
text: Stopped at a Fast Food shop with friends and a few locals wanted to fight us for no apparent reason. They hit and picked on one of my friends.

label: anger
text: "This summer I got into a fight with one of our patrons (at a theatre). He hit me and I hit him and her friend, he hit my friend and we all hit eachother."

label: sadness
text: When they told me that my grandfather was rather ill.

label: joy
text: "At a success of mine, at a real achievement."

label: joy
text: "I found a human ""treasure"" that I desired and got immediately. I didn't think about anything. When I touched him I imploded but I am whole."

label: shame
text: "This is an event I will never forget.  I am considered a good mimic.  This particular day we were waiting for a professor to take her class.  This  professor had a peculiar accent and a very horrible way of lecturing and to top it all we had this class at the fag end of the day.  So this particular day I got into my element and started imitating the professor, and the professor entered the class right in the middle of it .  I was unaware of her presence, some of my friends tried to warn me but it was of no avail as I was too engrossed in mimicing.
