text: "I went shopping with my mother and sister (17 years old). Mother always told my sister what she should buy. Instead of assisting my sister in defending herself against mother's interference, I just behaved aggressively towards my sister."

label: fear
text: When I was first taken to the dissection room where I found 10 dead human bodies.

label: guilt
text: I slammed my little brother into a wall because he was bothering me.

label: joy
text: When I heard that I had passed the second year exams.

label: guilt
text: "One of my friends came to know through some other friends that I   had applied for some course in an institute.  He asked me ""why did not you tell me, I would also have applied.""  At that I felt guilty."

label: anger
text: When my rights to use a shared house had been usurped by co-owners out of pure selfishness.

label: disgust
text: When somebody despised a friend of mine.

label: sadness
text: Feeling unable to preserve one's ideas and ambitions as innocent as they are when you are young.

label: sadness
text: When I got separated from the man I loved so much.

label: anger
text: "We were at school, in the room for audiovisual classes.  We were watching a film, and just behind me two classmates were bothering me with their mocking and shoves.  I reacted angrily (I suppose)  by hitting one of them."

label: guilt
text: My schoolmates were teasing a pupil who was not able to defend himself very well; I should have taken his part.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgust when I saw a dead animal on the roadway.

label: fear
text: "I feared that I was pregnant.  It was not planned and I would have been compelled to have an abortion, which I would not have liked at all.  Fortunately, after a week's anxiety, I got to know that I was not pregnant."

label: shame
text: Saw on TV China not winning more gold medals in the Asian Olympics.

label: shame
text: "Making bloopers: e.g. telling something negative about a certain person, while that person is standing besides you and hears everything."

label: anger
text: I visited a special education school. The headmaster applied a policy of strict positive - negative reinforcement to the children involved. Children who measured up to his standards were made a fuss of - children who didn't were ignored.

label: shame
text: When I was about seven or eight I was caught having stolen a doll's dress from my next-door neighbour.

label: fear
text: A terrible fight that I provoked with my friend.

label: sadness
text: When I heard the news of my grandfather's sudden death.

label: sadness
text: Not getting on with someone of my classmates in high school.

label: shame
text: "I went for a walk with a very close friend; we were talking about our problems, I told her lies."

label: sadness
text: When I was eight years old my father was run over by a car. When I saw his body I was sad beyond words.

label: disgust
text: Saw a dead rat on the street.

label: anger
text: Last week a friend of mine called on me and said I was moody and difficult to persuade. With this I got angry with her.

label: fear
text: Going to a disco by myself to wait for some friends. We had separated and hadn't planned where to meet. I wasn't sure if they were even going to this place so I felt very conscious of being alone.

label: guilt
text: Not handing in homework in time.

label: disgust
text: "Having been unjustly punished, I feel disgust towards the person responsible."

label: guilt
text: I had promised myself that I would do one good deed every day.  One night I saw a beggar whose muscles had been atrophyed.  I walked passed him thinking that he was feigning.  Later I realized that he had not been pretending and I had a feeling of guilt as I had not kept my promise.

label: fear
text: When I thought that I had failed the examination.

label: fear
text: "Our tutorial group was soon to be divided, and we got a list of names of freshmen, out of which five were to be in my group.  We read the names and then each group went its own way to a seminar room.  I wondered how I would cope with the new situation and if I would succeed as a group leader."

label: joy
text: "When I was able to buy my new car, after lots of problems."

label: sadness
text: My father suddenly fell ill and died.

label: guilt
text: "I became very angry with my friend because he didn't do shopping, while we agreed on him doing this. My being angry was proved to be without reason and I felt guilty about it."

label: sadness
text: "When I missed my train this morning, I felt sad for some time."

label: anger
text: When an English teacher unfairly made me repeat a semester which I thought I had passed.  I had to ask my parents for some more money to carry on studying.

label: anger
text: My boy-friend had promised me to come an 10 a.m. - he was 3 hours late.

label: shame
text: When I boxed my child's ears.

label: anger
text: "Recently a good friend only called me when he needed something. He never said ""please"" or ""thank you"" or any other kind word."

label: guilt
text: "My friend had written a letter to me, the contents of which I misunderstood and I wrote back a very harsh letter to her.  On realizing the blunder I had made, I felt like hiding my face in the sand."

label: anger
text: "In the holiday cottage of our association, two of my pals came to wake me up early one morning by bringing a radio played at the highest volume into my room - it was the morning service at its loudest."

label: anger
text: "When a friend told me that my education had nothing to do with our discussion.  This friend has failed the 7th grade, what made me angry was that I had not used my education to argue."

label: sadness
text: When I had an argument with a friend.

label: fear
text: When I nearly collided with another car.

label: sadness
text: "I had to terminate a training because I wasn't suited for it. I was very sad about this, because I very much wanted to finish that training."

label: guilt
text: When an event took place in another's life and which I thought I could have avoided.

label: anger
text: "I was not given a chance to explain to my close relatives as to why I could not go to visit them when they were ill.  When I did go, they thought that I had been selfish and irresponsible duringtheir illness."

label: disgust
text: "In a lift a drunken, fat and untidy man tried to make advances at me."

label: anger
text: I get angry when my smaller brother misbehaves and talks with indecent words.

label: joy
text: When I saw that the mark I had obtained in an exam was a good one.

label: shame
text: I was angry about 3 months ago and I kicked backwards against the wall. It caved in and so I had to show it to my parents. I had been angry after my mother said something to me about not being able to find clothes in my size - something that I'm sensitive about. (6' 5'' 210)

label: joy
text: When I received a letter from the university telling me that my application had been accepted.

label: joy
text: "A friend which I hadn't seen for years, sent me a small present."

label: anger
text: When my sister broke my china tea set.

label: guilt
text: I did not deliver a message on time.

label: joy
text: Got through first semester University.

label: joy
text: When I was admitted to the Sofia University.

label: shame
text: "As part of the assessment I had to speak on a subject in front of the class. I was not really prepared and I was just reading the stuff I had on a piece of paper, when some of the students  asked me something I could not give them an answer.  I felt ashamed as I had not prepared the topic."

label: joy
text: I felt joy when I passed my Malawi School Certificate of Education.

label: joy
text: I felt this emotion when my name was announced on the radio that I had been selected to come to Lilongwe School for Health Sciences to take a training course as a Medical Assistat.

label: fear
text: When I was left alone at home one night by my brother.

label: sadness
text: When I heard about the death of somebody I liked very much and I was not present either to see the person or to try to share my emotions with other friends.

label: disgust
text: I was at a friend's place for lunch and she fell ill and vomited.

label: sadness
text: "When my mother scolded me for something, very insignificant, without knowing the real cause of what had happened. "

label: disgust
text: Cueing for bath for a long time.

label: fear
text: It was some years ago when one evening some people came home and told us my father was badly injured in an accident.

label: disgust
text: When my girlfriend told me that she was no longer interested in me.

label: sadness
text: "I last really felt sad when I left home for I was leaving all my long time, pre-kindergarten relationships behind."

label: anger
text: When one is unjustly accused of something one has not done.

label: anger
text: Heated discussion with spouse concerning new house.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a T.V programme on animals in the film world (mistreated and used).

label: disgust
text: "When I was walking on the street, I slipped on the dung of a dog. I did not fall down, but I felt disgusted by the bad smell on my sole."

label: fear
text: "One night, I was alone at home.  My fear was caused by some strange noises which put my imagination to work."

label: fear
text: When I was jumped by three men in a deserted area.

label: sadness
text: "I left my home in Melbourne to come to Q'land to study and before I hopped in the car I hugged my mother and shook hands with my father. Sensing immediately my father's sadness, I also had a flood of the same emotion."

label: disgust
text: The man who threw me out of the flat disgusted me.

label: shame
text: "My boyfriend's mother, whom I had not met earlier, made an unexpected visit.  I was lying lazily on the bed, reading a newspaper and my boyfriend was studying."

label: guilt
text: "Due to a misunderstanding on my part, two of my best friends quarelled."

label: fear
text: Every time I see a spider or a snake.

label: anger
text: I had worked long and hard on a project when a friend inadvertantly destroyed it. I could not forgive him for a long time. And at times still get angry at him.

label: disgust
text: Somebody went around spreading news that I like people with money.

label: fear
text: "I was walking from my friend's house, a few blocks from my house, when a car began to follow me. He waited I passed by it rotateed a little and stopped on my way. I changed completely my way and the car went on following me until I turned at a corner and running I hid in a garden of a house, waiting for the car to pass by. I went back home terribly afraid."

label: joy
text: I realized the girl liked to be with me.

label: fear
text: Getting ill.

label: joy
text: Found my name on the list of attending the English lectures.

label: joy
text: Can't remember specific event - besides just being moderately happy until a year or so ago.

label: shame
text: When the class leader read out the names of those chosen for the English lecture and I was not on the list.

label: guilt
text: My mother always evokes feelings of guilt in me. For instance when I miss the last bus I know she will be concerned for me and stay awake till I arrive.

label: joy
text: I stopped working (had a boring job).

label: guilt
text: "The night of a high school dance, I went partying and collided with another car. Both cars were totalled; people were injured but not seriously."

label: anger
text: "Physical violence. A friend wouldn't listen to me I repeatedly tried to warn him, to no avail. Result: eight people were ""pissed off""."

label: anger
text: When I got home I found that the electrical supply had been disconnected despite my having paid ZESCO the full bill a few  days earlier.

label: shame
text: "A man asked me: ""May I sleep in your stairway?""  and I answered ""No""."

label: joy
text: I took a math midterm and I knew I did really well and it was Friday so I felt great joy because the week was over and I did well on a test.

label: guilt
text: I moved to Nijmegen for my study. Soon after this my mother had to be admitted in hospital because of cardiac compliants. I knew that my moving was an important reason for this.

label: shame
text: I felt shame when I was asked by my cousin that I promised to buy her a birthday present but I didn't buy it for her in front of friends.

label: guilt
text: "I had gone to see one of our professors about a book, and I did not  attend the class she took a few minutes later."

label: fear
text: "This was at secondary school, a prefect framed up some case and took it to the deputy head-master.  I was called by the head-master and he threatened to suspend me."

label: shame
text: Caused fault in V.C.R. by not following instructions carefully.

label: joy
text: Reunion with my wife after a legal separation.

label: anger
text: When my chief accused me of an error that I hadn't made.

label: joy
text: I was for the first time on a brigade this year. At that time my sister was to bear a child. I was mad with joy when I opened the telegram from my parents and learned I had a nephew.

label: disgust
text: Because of the examination I had to study night and day.

label: joy
text: When I knew the feelings of a beloved person.

label: joy
text: My best friend chosen for your English lectures.

label: fear
text: Staying in a relative's house which was broken in before.

label: joy
text: "Spending the nitht with close friends, after being away (out of Nijmegen) for a while."

label: sadness
text: When I thought that it was going to be impossible for me to start studying (due to wrong information from the student advisor).

label: sadness
text: When I failed one of my courses at school - the university of Zambia.

label: shame
text: The 2nd time someone I had met cared for came over to my house I was absolutely inebriated and was sick into a bucket.

label: joy
text: When my father married a certain lady. The reception was held at Kasungu town Hall.

label: shame
text: Once when I said bad things concerning a friend.

label: fear
text: I had fear when I was left alone at the bus depot at night. I had problems of how to move to this place.

label: joy
text: "When I saw my 16 year old sister at home after having waited for her all night, not knowing where she was."

label: joy
text: I noticed that Meryl Streep and I had similar cheekbones and jaw structure.

label: fear
text: I got caught shoplifting a package of gummy bears.

label: disgust
text: My friend promised to take me out for a movie but he didn't turn up.

label: disgust
text: "When a member of the family complains about the food that is served, it disgusts me."

label: fear
text: Occured while preparing for a midterm in Social Welfare that I thought was going to be very hard and felt unprepared for.

label: guilt
text: "When I was with a girl who seemed to love me, while I was with her just to go to bed with her."

label: disgust
text: I thought that the guy I had been associating with for over a year went out 2 or 3 times with a high school girl whom he claimed not to like.

label: guilt
text: While playing basketball I broke a team member's spectacles.  His face was injured by the  pieces of glass.  It was not serious but I felt guilty and blamed myself for being too careless and vigorous in my game.

label: sadness
text: Losing a pet chick. Our family had just put the chick outside a few days before and then one morning it was gone.

label: guilt
text: "I felt that I contributed to a possible rift in the relationship between a boy and girl soon to be married, in my flat after I moved in. After stating my celibacy to him which she overheard and didn't previously know about I suspect."

label: sadness
text: When I was told a friend's baby had been born with only partial sight. This was her first child and she was not young (the mother that is).

label: joy
text: Someone (a boy) paid special attention to me.

label: joy
text: After my girl and I talked things over our relationship changed and became positive.  A diificult time turned into pleasant one.

label: shame
text: My article not chosen by the college newspaper

label: disgust
text: "The time when I cleaned the house and everything was tidy, then my cousin, who is 4 years old, came with a muddy pot and made a mess of the whole thing."

label: fear
text: When I was sitting in a car next to a man who was masturbating.

label: joy
text: The birth of my child.

label: sadness
text: I slept in a tent at the Barracks which caught fire at night and my best possessions got burnt in there.

label: joy
text: I was very happy when I discovered that I had passed my first year examination and was among the thirty students who would major in economics.

label: joy
text: "That was soon after the results of the interview which nearly 9,000 people attended in all the three regions of Malawi. My joy came after hearing on the radio that I was one of the people selected to undergo the Medical Assistant training at the L.S.H.S."

label: guilt
text: "I felt guilty when one of my secondary teacher left me while I was in Form three, he was the only one who showed love to me."

label: guilt
text: "The fridge we had at home had a lock.  One day when I wanted something, I unscrewed the door but unfortunately I was caught in the act."

label: disgust
text: Dead rat in the kitchen of the university.

label: fear
text: When I had gone to a school picnic and was left behind in the forest.

label: fear
text: "When I was told by the doctor, after many months of coughing, that I had tuberculosis."

label: shame
text: When my friend and I were discussing the good looks of a guy we realized that he had been listening.

label: joy
text: When I entered in the University after a year of struggles.

label: fear
text: I felt it at the same time when I felt disgust.

label: anger
text: When colliding with my car. I myself was to blame.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted at the way the bus conductor threw out an old woman oiut of the mini-bus simply because she could not pay the fare for her luggage.

label: disgust
text: When mum had beaten my young sister just because she had received a letter from a boyfriend.

label: fear
text: I was driving and stopped at a stop light. I was planning to make a right turn as soon as it was clear. It was clear on the left so I started but a man was just in front of the car.

label: shame
text: Since I've been here I haven't written to any of my relatives. I got a letter from my mom telling me how upset my grandparents are from not hearing from me.

label: anger
text: When I was teased by my friend for not scoring good marks in the exams.

label: disgust
text: In contact with a poor family of northeast it was offered to me a crab to eat at my request. But the fact that this crab was prepared antihygienically and his appearence was also antihygienically it caused me disgust but I ate it anyway.

label: disgust
text: The transport to pick us up for lunch was always late and the driver made the same excuse every day.

label: anger
text: "I was accused of a misdemeanour, unjustly."

label: shame
text: Once I did not have enough money to pay for a coffee.

label: disgust
text: "At an unworthy behaviour of a man, pettiness, stupidity and mostly at a philistinism."

label: guilt
text: "It was my mother's birthday. My father and I used to buy a present together. However, now I had bought something together with my girlfriend and I forgot to ask my father."

label: guilt
text: Passing by a good friend's home without coming in to visit him.

label: fear
text: "Many years ago I saw the film ""Psycho"" by Hitchcock for the first time. When I saw the film I was alone and afterwards I hardly dared to go to bed and hardly was able to sleep."

label: sadness
text: As a child - having a dog - it getting a disease and dying.

label: joy
text: A party with no worries (i.e. no tests homework etc.) many friends were present and good music.

label: joy
text: Returning to school and rejoining my girlfriend after 3 months of separation from summer.

label: shame
text: "When I was small, I would always fight with my younger sister and one time I hit her and knocked the wind out of her. I felt real bad about it."

label: sadness
text: I feel sad about an event I can not influence.

label: disgust
text: When I met my boyfriend with another girl.

label: sadness
text: Deceived by other people and ran into trouble.

label: joy
text: "This happened when I was in the 10th standard.  The paddy crops were in a bad shape as it had not rained and there was no water in the well, so I was in a very sad mood.  I came to the conclusion that I would ignore the paddy field, just 12 hours after this it rained for one hour.  This was a very tense time and the rain brought me tremendous pleasure."

label: shame
text: "Sitting on the bus seats supposed for disabled people, children and old people (by mistake)"

label: shame
text: Fighting with my father while drunk.

label: joy
text: Our basketball team is undefeated in league play (4-0) currently.

label: shame
text: I spent an evening with my girl-friend. When we wanted to go to bed I was totally drunk. Next morning I felt rather ashamed.

label: joy
text: The day I got a letter from the U.G.C informing me that I had been awarded the junior research fellowship.

label: shame
text: "I had a girlfriend in the same class I was. I did not do well in my Exams, but she did satisfactorily well and was taken into another class leaving me behind."

label: anger
text: Being insulted in public for the wrong reason.

label: anger
text: The emotion came when a certain boy opened my locker without my knowledge.

label: joy
text: The situation in which I felt happiest in my life was when I was with the person I love for the first time.

label: joy
text: "I feel joy usually after each taken exam, the last one was in February."

label: joy
text: "My sister in law was about to have a child, and there were some problems.  They had to do a Caesarean.  After a while, everything  was all right."

label: fear
text: "Students fear many things but we seem to fear the examinations most of all. I remember I was horror stricken before my microbiology exam, because it was a decisive one."

label: shame
text: When my mother caught me masturbating.

label: guilt
text: When I beat up a first year student at my secondary school in my capacity as the deputy head boy.  He had woken up late in the  morning for manual work.

label: anger
text: Insulted by other people in the shop.

label: guilt
text: "When I forgot to cook something that my mother had told me to, and at supper time the food that I was supposed to have prepared was not there."

label: anger
text: I had planned to go to town with my friend at 1500 hours but she went for the registration and I waited for a good 1 and a 1/2 hours.  It was vital for me to go to town but I could not as it was she who had the money.  Finally I borrowed some money from friends and we went to town.  I was really angry with my friend.

label: joy
text: I felt happy when I saw my brother at the bus depot after 3 months without seing each other.

label: guilt
text: I have chosen to put my son in a private school were the examination marks are low.  Every time that he gives me his term results I am left with a sense of guilt.

label: sadness
text: When I felt alone and without love.

label: guilt
text: Telling white lies.

label: sadness
text: I was very sad when I was shouted at by Uncle and was told that I was not to be given school fees because I didn't go to work in the garden since I had gone to escort my sister to the bus depot.

label: disgust
text: My girlfriend came home after a business dinner at the most expensive place in town drunk as a skunk. Whats more she drove home and couldn't remember doing so. I was disgusted by her state and her actions.

label: guilt
text: A girl whom I hadn't seen for a period of time told me that she had been pregnant and had an abortion - I was the father.

label: joy
text: "I experienced this feeling when I was accepted as a student. Because everything turned out different from my expectations. Although I passed the exam successfully I was accepted as a student only when I didn't expect it at all, namely at the beginning of September."

label: anger
text: Being told that I am a stupid person.

label: joy
text: "I was appreciated by others, especially my family members and my friends."

label: sadness
text: When my parents and sister went on a trip and I was separated from them for about three months.

label: joy
text: My son was registered to get admission in grade one of the         primary school.  The chances of him getting a place there was 1/10.  Two weeks later I was informed that he had been enrolled.

label: anger
text: "When they threw my holder down on the floor, with all my notes for an exam inside it and they got all mixed up."

label: guilt
text: "When I had lied, saying that I never take bread from the dinning hall and a friend of mine caught me doing it.  He thus proved to me that I did in fact take the bread."

label: anger
text: When a boy who was drunk came into my room and misbehaved in the presence of my boyfriend.

label: fear
text: I felt this feeling when one day my landlord's cat had crept under my bed and I couldn't cope with it during an hour and a half.

label: shame
text: "In an examination ,which other students found easy I could hardly think and did not know what to answer."

label: anger
text: When I found one of my new pullovers wrinkled inside the wardrobe.  My brother had done it.

label: shame
text: When I purposely locked my babysitter out of the house at age 4 because I DIDN'T LIKE HER.

label: shame
text: I can't remember ever feeling shame.

label: guilt
text: I feel always guilty before my parents when I come home and have to tell them I have failed an exam.

label: joy
text: "I had not seen my brother for five years as he was not in Spain.   When he arrived at the airport, I felt great joy."

label: sadness
text: "Losing close people and animals. So far, I've felt most when losing our dog in a traffic accident."

label: guilt
text: "I made a remark to my sister concerning her attitude to men, the way she talked and I compared her to an acquaintance of mine.  Later, the same evening, my sister looked sad.  I felt guilty about her sadness."

label: sadness
text: Social situation - at the pub - a close friend of 2 years told the group around us of advances I had made.

label: disgust
text: When one of my friends started misbehaving.

label: anger
text: "When a relative, who had come to our place, created untidyness and dirtyness."

label: disgust
text: I was insulted without a reason by a drunk man.

label: fear
text: Before giving a seminar to a rather large audience.

label: joy
text: I had the unexpected possibility to see a friend I like very much.

label: sadness
text: When my gradmother died.

label: guilt
text: When I stole something.

label: joy
text: "The day the results of the university entrance exam was published, I found my canditate number and I was very excited."

label: shame
text: "A few days back I had a tutorial class and the teacher randomly assigned one person in each group to make a presentation.  The discussion in our group had been confused and the presentation was not very well prepared.  Unfortunately I was selected to present and I could not keep calm, was confused and result was very poor.  I really felt ashamed."

label: anger
text: When people would tell me that my ex-girlfriend was playing around on me.

label: shame
text: "There is one thing which makes me feel shameful,  when I see friends of my age group working and earning a lot, when I am still studying.  A friend I met a week ago after a period of 5 years is earning more than Rs 3000/ month."

label: sadness
text: "It was mid May 1985, When we had a Test on Nursing. My classmate had an answer sheet, so he tried to peep. The Nursing Tutor caught him. During this time I was turning my question paper and it made noise. This friend blamed me of causing the whole matter for him to be caught."

label: fear
text: Held under water by a large wave and thought I was drowning.

label: anger
text: My bicycle was demolished.

label: joy
text: "I had a very close friend who went to Canada after her F.B, his  departure was unavoidable.  When he came back during the Summer holidays I was very happy as nothing had changed between us."

label: guilt
text: "I was involved in a ... attempt on a man I had developed a close warming relationship with. Although I knew I had done everything I could and that his progress of a ""normal"" life was poor I felt guilty as if I could have done more."

label: disgust
text: They asked me to throw the rubbish into a dustbin which had some awful liquid accumulated at the bottom.

label: sadness
text: "I had a very short term romance during the summer vacations.  When we first met I felt excited but I wanted to avoid him after we had met a few times and so I proposed that we stay apart, I felt very sad then."

label: sadness
text: My cat died from an illness.  It had been with us for 7 years.  It was a lovely cat.  It had been ill for one or two weeks and the veterinary surgeon had told us that it was dying.

label: disgust
text: "I once watched the series called ""Dynasty"" on TV, and I detested it."

label: disgust
text: A friend of mine goes out with this guy. She sleeps with him but is quite happy for him to play around - as well as herself.

label: sadness
text: When I heard my grandfather's wife had leukemia I was very sad.

label: disgust
text: I was disgusted at the existing red-tape in the government offices.  I accquired my passport three months after having applied for it and I had to go back five times to them to correct a minor error.

label: shame
text: "When I was 10, I got busted for stealing a candy-bar."

label: guilt
text: "I had promised to do a task for someone that was close to me, and from the outset I knew it was important that I do it, but when it came to it, I let them down."

label: shame
text: The day I learnt that my girlfriend had been going around with  a close friend of mine.

label: disgust
text: When a boy had continued to use foul language and swearing in front of a group of my friends.

label: sadness
text: My mother was unwell and went for many cancer tests. She spent time in hospital being opened and closed many times.

label: shame
text: The first time that I had to go up on the stage to give a speech.

label: disgust
text: "A colleague and I were sitting on a bench next to an old man in a shopping centre. the old man coughed and spluttered somewhat, then with his fingers removed the resultant phlegm and mucous from his mouth, and transferred it onto the armrest of the bench."

label: disgust
text: When I failed to secure employment after my form 5 in Lusaka despite my excellent certificate.

label: fear
text: When there was a fight at home and my father threatened to throw a chair on my brother.

label: anger
text: "My mother had for some time been trying to separate me from a good friend who, she thought, was not good company for me.  Finally, at breakfast one day, we had an argument and I tried to defend my friend."

label: disgust
text: "When I dined with my new friends, one of them kept reminding us that he was superior."

label: joy
text: When I saw my family after a separation of one year.

label: joy
text: A few weeks back I received a Christmas card from a friend in England.  She had not written to me in a very long time but it     showed that she still remembered me.

label: disgust
text: "When I went to visit a relative and saw how messy and dirty his place was, in the absence of his wife."

label: joy
text: When I passed successive exams to enter the school of medicine.

label: fear
text: "I was camping in an old broken hut which had no lights.  I had brought along a lamp which was not working very well.  The door made strange sounds and I was sure that strange things were happening.  The most terrifying bit was that there were many wardrobes in the hut and everytime that I looked in the glass of the wardrobe I felt that there were ""objects"" behind me.   The whole night was spent in fear and restlessness."

label: fear
text: It was not long ago when I and two of friends of mine got quite drunk and one of them began to rave under the influence of the alcohol. I felt fear of what could have happened.

label: fear
text: "When I had gone for a boxing tournament which ended at 2 o'clock in the morning.  I was alone on my way back, and I could hear the barking of the dogs, the nocturnal animals and the sound of my     own footsteps.  There had been a rumour  circulating that there were ghosts in that area."

label: disgust
text: "I was an instructior in a youth organization.  Whenever we, the instructors would have a meeting the advisor would be present.  He did not understand our worknig conditions but talked a lot and had a lot of outdated ideas.  Whenever we disagreed with him he was very discontent and said that we had a prejudice against him.  Why did he have to treat us as his subordinates ?"

label: fear
text: Being driven by friend who suddenly swerved and skidded a little. It was night and on a long trip. We ended up on side of road.

label: joy
text: "When I dived among sharks and the brightly coloured fish on the outer reef of Tvavni, Fidgi."

label: disgust
text: Whenever I spoke to a female classmate I felt disgusted.  She said meaningless things and seemed to indicate something to me but I did not love/like her.

label: sadness
text: "The death of a relative, friend, or someone I esteem."

label: guilt
text: I angered a close friend and he was injured.

label: fear
text: Thinking about death when walking alone at night.

label: fear
text: Before examination.

label: disgust
text: "Once again, my life partner came back home drunk at midnight."

label: fear
text: "During one year my mother almost had a nervous breakdown and my father had a serious operation. I was afraid that our family (4 kids, I'm the oldest) wouldn't hold together. Everything turned out fine."

label: disgust
text: "I am disgusted by people who spoil their identity because of misbehaviour.  This morning when I was in a crowded bus, I found a seat on which a university student was sitting on one side and he had put his bag and files next to him.  There was very little space left and I sat down while he kept on reading.  Even when I leaned on him he did not put his bag away.  He did not respond and I felt very angry."

label: shame
text: During a party I overheard a conversation about china. When I wanted to give my opinion one of the people came out to be Chinese and his opinion was right of course.

label: anger
text: When a few girls were talking rubbish about me.

label: joy
text: "On my birthday, when a very close friend sent me a huge bouquet of flowers."

label: guilt
text: I had shown anger toward my dog and he was killed later that day.

label: joy
text: I felt joy when I heard my name being called on the radio as one of the students who had passed the interview of Nursing and was selected to start Nursing.

label: shame
text: "Walking on the street passing by an air duct, my skirt went up."

label: fear
text: When the week for Exams came. I got afraid as to how I would tackle the questions.

label: sadness
text: "Loneliness, being uncertain of myself in the Autumn."

label: shame
text: "Feeling inadequate in a group situation, being unable to convey my own thoughts and feelings."

label: disgust
text: "Grandfather lives in a home for the elderly. He always looks forward to visits. On his birthday (by coincidence it was on ""Mummy's day"") however, nobody went to see him. Is the own family more important than grandfather ?"

label: guilt
text: My younger sister wanted to take classes to learn a musical instrument.  One Saturday morning my mother asked me to go with        her for the registration.  I did not want to go  so I said that there might be many bad people at the club.  As a resullt my sister was scolded by my mother.

label: disgust
text: "This person I know lied about how much income his parents made and received money through grants which he did not need. Another person is barely making it, did not lie, and did not receive enough money."

label: joy
text: When I passed and qualified for the university.

label: shame
text: "For example, to feel bad because of one's attire, to be among people who do not belong to the same social class, to give a wrong answer in class, to be surprised in particular situations."

label: fear
text: When I dreamt that my family was in trouble and was facing many difficulties.

label: sadness
text: A girlfriend ended our relationship in an abrupt and unexpected manner.

label: fear
text: "When a car ran into me. The moment that I felt on the street I thought ""This is my end, I am going to die""."

label: anger
text: Being treated unfairly and being hurt by someone I love.

label: fear
text: "One afternoon, helping at home on the property, I was (mustering) getting in cattle and a bull turned and came for me."

label: shame
text: A few days back I had to ask a professor a ridiculous question because I had lost at a game of cards and had to pay a forfeit.

label: shame
text: "When my father found me in bed with a girl, we were deep in actioon when he entered the room."

label: fear
text: Vertigo - standing on a ladder and painting the house.

label: joy
text: "When I was 17, I had a mystic vision. I melted into a dazzling light, which omitted perfect love. The physical experience became unimportant, I heard or saw the words ""overcome egotism"". The feeling of joy remained for month after that experience."

label: sadness
text: When my grandmother after staying with us for awhile went back home.

label: fear
text: "After seeing a terror movie at the cinema, I was so scared that I couldn't even drive the car into the garage. I often thought about the film afterwards, hoping such things couldn't exist in the ""real world""."

label: guilt
text: I get irritated with my son when he screams or is sick all over his clean clothes.

label: fear
text: When I walk through streets late at night. This is because I and my friends were attacked one night without any reason for it.

label: sadness
text: "Losing my girlfriend who made an end to our relationship. By this I lost an important source of support, certainty and joyful moments. I cried very intensly when that happened."

label: fear
text: When I decided to separate from my husband.

label: shame
text: At a weakness on my part.

label: sadness
text: Death in the close family.

label: guilt
text: When I was scolded by my dad for bad behaviour.

label: guilt
text: When I took away my best friend's boyfriend.

label: joy
text: "I felt joyful when my boyfriend met me at the station, while at first he had said that he would not do that."

label: anger
text: I arrived in Vienna in the middle of the night. I asked for some silly information - as I realized myself afterwards - and the inquiry  clerk reacted in a very arrogant manner.

label: sadness
text: "When my grandfather died I was extremely sad.  However my family members did not have any special feelings, they said that he was already 80 years old."

label: sadness
text: A child beaten up by his mother.

label: shame
text: Once I went home totally drunk and roused all our neighbours from sleep.

label: shame
text: "A person (a male) told me that he liked me.  He has a problem, he is a homosexual."

label: disgust
text: The male friend of my mother (a widow) moved in to live with us.  I did not like the man.

label: sadness
text: The loss of my mother.

label: joy
text: "After sitting for the Standard 8 Exams for the second time in 1979, I had great joy when I heard that I was successful in the Examination when the results were out."

label: joy
text: When I had achieved a goal indirectly. I work for CAL Football and our 2nd win of the season was very gratifying and brought our joy because of the hard work involved and the fact that no one expected we would win.

label: joy
text: "When I met my boyfriend and we discovered that we shared the same ideals and goals in life, and that we could share all our feelings and thoughts and felt that the world's not so bad when you have someone really close to share your life with."

label: anger
text: "When I saw a man hitting a child of 2 years without any consideration, simply because the child had been leaning against a window."

label: fear
text: "Whenever I am alone in a dark room, walk alone on the street, sleep alone in the room at night or see something which is only partly visible.  This emotion was very strong when as an 8 year   old child I saw something horrible.  "

label: shame
text: "I played in a stage play. Suddenly, in front of 200 people, I could not remember the words I had to say."

label: anger
text: "Without my permission, my son had made popcorn after coming back from school.  The consequences were a spoilt kettle and chaos in the kitchen but what could have happened with the hot grease ?"

label: anger
text: When a friend who comes visiting me unexpectedly asks for coffee and I refuse to give him this.

label: guilt
text: "When I saw a program on Ethiopia on T.V, a fews hours earlier I had thrown away some clothes and food."

label: sadness
text: "An uncle of mine who just retired, having worked hard all his life, got a cerebral hemorrhage."

label: disgust
text: I'm very disgusted when I see people abusing their body with drugs and alcohol. They take advantage of these things usually for an excuse for the fantasies which they like and so they do things stupidly and unjustly.

label: guilt
text: A friend of mine shot himself through the head after having told me and others that he would do so.

label: fear
text: "When I witnessed a bus accident in which a bus, full of passengers,  nearly overturned on the Lusaka-Kabwe road."

label: sadness
text: "The time I lost a badminton match, that I should have won at the Zambia closed badminton championships."

label: guilt
text: Shouting at my parents because I was angry about something else.

label: joy
text: When my son was born.

label: sadness
text: "When my sister died, she was only sixteen when she was put to rest."

label: anger
text: When I got the feeling that I had to do all the housekeeping while my boyfriend didn't do anything. This happened in a period of exams when I had to study very hard.

label: shame
text: "I felt shame and I couldn't look into my teacher's eyes, after not attending his lectures."

label: fear
text: When I was convinced that someonne had broken into my flat and I woke up and heard sounds that frightened me.

label: joy
text: When I received a beautiful birthday gift form my parents.

label: joy
text: When my term paper was evaluated.

label: disgust
text: During my birthday party a friend drank too much alcohol. So much that he had to throw up. Worst of all was that he couldn't leave my friend alone and that he was molesting her.

label: guilt
text: Made a mistake at work.

label: guilt
text: I had a girlfriend which I used to call regularly. Then I didn't phone her for a while. At a certain moment I felt a little tension which became worse.

label: guilt
text: "I didn't tell my parents exacly what had made me so late in getting home one night. I left out some details and somehow, I felt I had lied to them."

label: joy
text: One night I had a very good conversation with two friends. I then realized how worthy they were for me and how happy I was to have them as friends.

label: fear
text: When I was nearly attackad by a man who had been chasing me.

label: shame
text: When I was not in a position to control myself.  I had said too much and had been cruel with no other than my mother.

label: disgust
text: The lift of Stockholm central station stank of vomit and urine.

label: joy
text: I got better marks in the examn than many arrogant people.

label: joy
text: Some time ago a close relative of mine got off cheap with the worst.

label: guilt
text: I felt guilty when I had refused to lend money to my friend who needed it immediately.

label: joy
text: When  fell in love with my present girlfriend.

label: fear
text: "One night I had a feeling that somebody was stealing my car, but I was too frightened to go and see."

label: guilt
text: A friend asked for help and I was not able to help.

label: joy
text: When the parents of my girlfriend gave permission to spend our holiday together.

label: anger
text: "When my father phoned me to come home from my vacation, since he no longer had the time to look after my garden and animals."

label: anger
text: I once was accused of falling in love with someone's girlfriend which was not true because the girl was just a friend of mine.

label: joy
text: "I was going to my village, after having been rather oppressed in Madrid. "

label: shame
text: I was misbehaving in the agency.

label: anger
text: Insulted by teacher.

label: sadness
text: A good friend of mine died. During the funeral I felt an intense feeling of sadness.

label: shame
text: "After lot of explanation, to fail in my work."

label: disgust
text: When junior doctors returned to work after bunking them.

label: fear
text: "When I was about to be bitten by my friend's dog, later on it bit me."

label: disgust
text: I was on a walk with my child when I met a drunk woman.

label: guilt
text: "A few lies that I had indulged in, a few years ago, while raising loans from my friends."

label: sadness
text: The inability to read a book at college.

label: shame
text: "Recently, I left my bag in the car of someone who picked me up while hitch-hiking. I spent some effort to find out where he lived (I succeeded)."

label: anger
text: When they changed my office to another room without my agreement.

label: disgust
text: I went to a restaurant with my boyfriend for dinner. There we saw a couple. the man of the couple was a negro and he hadn't manners for eat.

label: anger
text: Bought something bad from the shop and they refused to change it.

label: guilt
text: Breaking the left hand indicator box by moving too close to structure.

label: shame
text: I was wearing slippery shoes and I tumbled down in a place where there were many people walking by.

label: disgust
text: I felt disgusted when a certain lady spoke words of sarcasm when I was trying to propose to her.

label: joy
text: On my birthday a friend came to see me unexpectedly and brought me flowers. I usually do not see her very often.

label: sadness
text: When a close friend drowned in the American River.

label: joy
text: My cousin asked me to be a bridesmaid for her. This made really happy because I was adopted into the family and her asking me made me realise that she saw me as a cousin and not just another person. There were other cousins she could have asked but she asked me.

label: joy
text: "I was in ILHA GRANDE with a wonderful sun, with wonderful people, with a wonderful sea, with a wonderful boy."

label: fear
text: We were in the country and I walked away from the others one night.  Suddenly something moved sharply in front of me and I was not able to see what it was.

label: fear
text: "When I was on a cave excursion with friends, I suddenly lost them and was afraid of losing my way in the cave."

label: fear
text: First time in anatomy.

label: sadness
text: When I was 10/11 years old my father travelled very much for his work (he passed three months away from home).

label: disgust
text: "The behaviour of a colleague of mine, which doesn't correspond to my norms of behaviour."

label: guilt
text: Going out with another girl besides my girlfriend and not telling her.

label: guilt
text: Leaving home when my mother thought I had no reason to go and felt that I was rejecting her. She is a constantly depressed person (a bit of a worry-wort) and I felt guilty about having given her this additonal problem.

label: sadness
text: Close relative is dying of cancer - found out last week.

label: sadness
text: "Not succeeding in a cross-country skiing competition, which I intended to win."

label: anger
text: "When I came for the lesson, it was cancelled and I had to fill in a questionnaire instead."

label: shame
text: Not chosen for all English classes.

label: fear
text: "When I did not get admission in M.Sc after my B.Sc, I felt really bad.  When I started my journey to Bombay, after having accepted my uncle's offer to come to Bombay, I was afraid, wondering if I  would succeed or not. "

label: disgust
text: "When at school I thought that I was going to get the best results in mathematics, but it was someone else who got the prize."

label: fear
text: At noon one Sunday I received a phone call telling me that my mother had been knocked down by a car at the street crossing and that her husband should go and see her.  I could not believe this as my father and my mother had gone out together to buy lunch boxes.  However I immediately ran to the scene of the accident.

label: guilt
text: "I took some money from my parent's house without asking them for it, and I was caught red handed."

label: shame
text: "I went to see a friend. There were other people, too, and everybody brought some present. I was the onlyone who brought nothing. My friend was very hospitable and did not show anything - although I knew how he felt."

label: guilt
text: While quarreling with my brother I broke the glass door of the cupboard and a china doll.  We were scolded by my father for breaking the door but we did not tell him about the door.

label: anger
text: "When I encountered not only with my father's lack of understanding but also with his unwillingness to understand me as a parent, as far as things for which I (not he) have proves to be right are concerned."

label: shame
text: "My mother told my uncle who is a Roman Catholic Priest (Redemptist Father) that I had been living in a de-facto relationship for three years. He was very, very angry at me."

label: sadness
text: When the gear broke on my car.

label: joy
text: I had met someone and we became good friends. Our relationship grew closer and now he is my boyfriend. I felt joy when I found out how he felt about me.

label: disgust
text: "A girl, who is a friend of mine was having an affair with a boy who is also a friend of mine.  I got to know that this girl was also seeing another guy.  Later on, she just broke off with this friend of mine without giving any explanations.  This made him sad and depressed, and I felt disgust for this girl."

label: shame
text: "When I was found urinating, behind a toilet instead of inside it, by my class mates and the teachers.  I was told to pick up my own urine from the wet soil, I did it."

label: sadness
text: "I remember the day my father died. I was 11 years old and my sadness was so great that until today I remember everything about that day, from the clothes I was wearing to the reactions of people, the despair of my mother and brother. It marked me a lot and was the greatest sadness I felt."

label: sadness
text: When I failed a test at my primary school.  I was then in grade 7 and we were about to take the main exam.

label: fear
text: "When I was at a boarding school at Lusaka, the Rhodesian soldiers came to bomb a house near our school and we saw the whole scene."

label: fear
text: Before an examination.

label: sadness
text: When I found that my coldness had hurt somebody's sincerity.

label: fear
text: I was afraid when my first boyfriend threatened to make an end to our relationship because he didn't love me enough while I loved him very much.

label: guilt
text: When I scored the third goal to my own side at a football match against William Murray Secondary School and we were badly defeated.

label: disgust
text: A friend told me how he managed to win the sympathy of as many people as possible. He said he first listened to what they said and then he tried to only say things they would like to hear. He would never express his own opinion. I felt really disgusted when he told that.

label: shame
text: It was when my father caught me with a girl in dark corners and asked me what I was doing there.

label: anger
text: "When I was misleaded by a person who assured that something would not occur, that I had no reason to prepccupy myself, and suddenly I saw myself implicated by the fact, because of the incompetence, and irresponsibility of that person."

label: anger
text: When during Winter the water pipes froze and we did not have any water for two days.

label: joy
text: When I understood I was admitted to the Sofia University.

label: shame
text: "I went to visit Montrose home for crippled children to interview a handicapped child. I interviewed two boys and it went really well. I promised I would visit them, but never got the time. Now I hope they've forgotten me, but I feel ashamed of letting them down."

label: fear
text: My car skidded on the wet street.

label: disgust
text: When I saw a male engineer one year and came back to find he was now a female (I don't know it/them personally).

label: anger
text: My family told me to leave if I was not willing to accept the conditions they imposed on me.

label: fear
text: I was driving on to a busy freeway during rush hour and it was slightly raining. A diesel truck was coming very close behind me and I was close behind a pick-up. I changed lanes and barely hit the truck and ran a Honda of the road. I was scared to death to go back and see if I caused him to crash.

label: guilt
text: "The same as in ""shame""."

label: joy
text: "I went on a picnic to the country side park.  The beautiful scenary made me feel relaxed and every worry disappeared , thus the picnic was worthwhile."

label: guilt
text: Ignoring my parents'wishes.

label: anger
text: When my dress was stolen.

label: anger
text: I felt angry when I failed in an exam about which I knew quite a few things and I did not deserve to be plucked.

label: anger
text: "When my father took away my cherised diaries to burn them (I was also very sad) ""Oh, how I hated him""."

label: disgust
text: In May somebody blamed me that I made him to be caught while peeping during the Nursing Test which made me feel disgusted.

label: guilt
text: I had quarelled with a friend of mine and I later realized that it was also my fault.

label: fear
text: I experienced fear when I was not prepared for the final year degree exams.

label: disgust
text: "I detest any kind of constraint and hate the attempts of elder people to force me to a norm of behavior without having legal or moral rights to do it. I felt this emotion when a neighbour of mine made me kick out my guests because they had talked very loudly and threatened that with ""connections"" she will expel me from the inst."

label: anger
text: When I was at an official meeting I asked a question to a person. His response was not directed at me but at the chairman.

label: disgust
text: "Sort of awkward. I'd introduced (a lover) but introduced as a friend to some members of my family, and my niece Yavanna who's six was home from school and at Mum's and Dad's and was really silly and at first it was ok, but it went on and on - yukky pooh! You eat your snot, etc. and I felt cross she wouldn't stop. But she had an audience and was in one of those moods. Once I'd accepted it was something everyone does at time I felt better - it was partly having my friend there."

label: guilt
text: "A child was admitted in hospital with Meningitis. I was asked to do lumber puncture to obtain Celebral Spinal fluid for diagnostic purposes. Since the condition was already bad, the child died as soon as I finished the procedure."

label: fear
text: "When a friend of mine discussed with me, I felt fear of losing her. This occurred because we had a missunderstanding between mutual colleagues."

label: shame
text: "Put down by my father - at a family outing at mutual family friends dinner. Told ""Not to Speak"". The attitude by him was negative/I was in mid 20s, I had done many things - a wide range of experiences. Probably greater than he."

label: guilt
text: "When a classmate wanted to sit down, I pulled his chair away, so that he was slightly injured."

label: disgust
text: When I made love with someone who I didn't really love. Sometimes I even considered him unlikable.

label: anger
text: "My flatmate was asking questions about my relationship with my boyfriend, whether I wasn't treating him as unfairly as I claimed he'd been treating me. As a result, I was angered, and became defensive."

label: fear
text: When biking and I felt very bad (problems with heart and respiration).

label: anger
text: When my boyfriend wouldn't dance with me on my graduation night because he thought I could dance with my friends who were friendly.

label: guilt
text: Getting a D in a class last semester and knowing it was because I didn't study.

label: disgust
text: Finding out that some students are getting good reports they do not deserve.

label: guilt
text: I ignored and offended my parents on the eve of the New Year.

label: fear
text: When I was watching a movie in which there was a pit full of dangers and there was only a small safe place on which a man was standing; he had to catch the lady who was thrown in or else ! The pit was 20 feet deep.

label: shame
text: Finding out that China does not have enough foreign currency to buy books.

label: sadness
text: "The death of my father, even though we had not been very close to each other."

label: shame
text: When I did not buy what I had promised to.

label: fear
text: "When I was first exposed to the dead bodies, for dissecting        purposes at the school of medicine."

label: disgust
text: "One day I went to town to get my grocery.  On my way back, I took a mini bus which was full of drunk students.  I felt very disgusted."

label: sadness
text: I received the mid-term exam paper of one of my major subjects and I found that I had failed it.

label: shame
text: When a close friend entrusted me with a secret and I let the cat out of the bag.

label: sadness
text: "I am filled with gloom and sadness at the death of a person.  More specifically, I felt sad after hearing the news of a death of a person who was hale and hearty and full of life, withvigour and plans for the next day but had no next day to cherish it."

label: sadness
text: My examination results were not satisfactory even though I had tried my best.  Then I started wondering about my abilities for the major subject.  However I did not know how to choose my major subject if I were to change it.

label: joy
text: I received an unexpected B+ on an engineering midterm. I did not study nearly as much as I should have and it was a difficult test.

label: shame
text: I was very much ashamed after a friend beat me at school and I was defeated.

label: shame
text: Failing an examn.

label: joy
text: When my last year's second semester results came through - I was ecstatic.

label: joy
text: The day I got married was the happiest day of my life.  Both of us felt that we were right for each other in every way and we had no doubts about our compatibility right from the day we got engaged.

label: guilt
text: Sometime back I came across a certain man who was badly beaten by some people because he was found raping the wife of the village headman.

label: disgust
text: "I was looking after a dying patient at work one night, a young woman, my colleague was talking to her relatives and .... to offer them any support emotionally, physically and then sent them down to the coffee shop to have a dinner rather than offering the facilities available for their use cause it involved her having to do some work. Seeing them again I felt disgusted at her attitude."

label: sadness
text: "When you are far away from relatives and friends. I feel sad for my early years, for the freedom and the carefree years of childhood."

label: fear
text: "As a passenger in a vehicle travelling from the steep side of Arthur's Pass in the middle of a sleet-storm, icy roads, sheer chasms to one side, sheer face to the other."

label: anger
text: "My sister came back home and reproached me for not having tidied up the house, although I had been working all morning and she had done nothing."

label: anger
text: "A few months ago when I was teaching, I suddenly became very angry at the children and slapped some of them."

label: guilt
text: "I was working as a secretary.  My boss was to go to give a lecture, and wanted me to give him the exact address of the place."

label: shame
text: I borrowed a gold bracelet without the girl's knowledge. I had it for so long I had to keep it. To this day I feel ashamed at myself for having it. I never wear the thing anymore.

label: fear
text: A grenade blew out next to me.

label: shame
text: When I went for the first time in my life to a nudist-beach.

label: sadness
text: "Recently, my sister-in-law's horse was poisoned by a plant and died. The horse was very obedient and exceptional with children."

label: anger
text: "A few days back a friend of mine poked me in the ribs for fun's sake, though I had warned him an infinite number of times that it really hurts me, he did it again.  I usually ignore this but this time I flared up for a split second and threatened to bash him up.  This is the latest incident when I lost my temper, though I felt very bad about it later."

label: shame
text: I was really shameful when my mother beat me in the presence of my friends because I didn't cook lunch up until 2 o'clock.

label: anger
text: I bought a new bed for my apt. and it squeaks when you move on it. I tried to fix it but could not.

label: disgust
text: When my fellow classmates were involved in a quarrel.

label: guilt
text: Yelled at my parents for not buying me a car like other parents.

label: shame
text: Sincerely I'm a very timid guy and so even in very simple situations sometimes I am ashamed.

label: guilt
text: When I offended my parents without wanting it.

label: fear
text: Walking in the dark and thinking about ghost stories.

label: shame
text: I once felt shame when I failed to fulfil the promise to marry a daughter of a certain gentleman.

label: disgust
text: Foreign students playing loud music in the night before the biology examn.

label: joy
text: I was filled with joy when I heard that I had passed my Secondary school leaving certificate exam.

label: shame
text: I felt the above condition when I was found in a house playing with another man's wife where I was asked questions and I was unable to answer.

label: anger
text: We were just about to go into the Exam room and I didn't see all my writing materials plus the identification card from the place where I left them.

label: joy
text: When I met a good friend of mine after a long time.

label: disgust
text: Saw two Canadian students boasting about how rich they are in Canada.

label: anger
text: "I felt anger when at the end of a telephone call, a good friend told me that she would go to travel next year with another good friend. We couldn't talk this out."

label: guilt
text: "When I am not able to fulfill any request of my son - can't take him out to ride his byke, because I am tired."

label: joy
text: I met a certain lady at Mchesi and I proposed a word of love to her and at the same time she accepted my proposal.

label: shame
text: "In a restaurant, I made the acquaintance of a boy who always told the same things in a very loud voice. I laughed and said to him that he always repeated the same things. Some time later I heard that he had undergone a complicated brain operation."

label: shame
text: When ditched - divorced by husband.

label: anger
text: "I was the compere at a party and all my efforts to get the show rolling were thwarted by the immobile, non co-operative guests.  I felt frustation - bordering on anger."

label: shame
text: I was in a bus with my school material when I fell and sat on the lap of another passenger.

label: shame
text: I was severely reprimanded for a trivial offence in front of members of my peer group while still at school.

label: disgust
text: "When I was in the army, we got a certain dish for dinner that I do not like at all. We were not obliged to eat, but I was very hungry."

label: anger
text: When I heard that I was not to be provided with another pair of medical uniform.

label: joy
text: "Football was a very big deal at my high school, so I was joyous when my school's team won the conference championship last year."

label: joy
text: Finding my glasses again after having lost them in town.

label: fear
text: The time I was threatened with expulsion from secondary school (form four).

label: joy
text: Doing unexpectedly well in an examn.

label: disgust
text: To loose friends because of them over-estimating themselves.

label: guilt
text: "During a ski tour with a friend, we two had drunk too much. When we went down the slope on ski, I lost my friend who had lost his way. I thought that something must have happened to him (he finally arrived but after a very long time)."

label: anger
text: People having a football match outside the window during the lecture.

label: guilt
text: "When some housemen told me a young girl like you should not be allowed to lecture to consultants, I was too shy to argue against them."

label: shame
text: When I failed the grade 7.

label: fear
text: When I stayed alone in a house in Great Brittain and there was a lot of rumour in the newspaper about a murderer still being free.

label: fear
text: Listening to horrot stories at night.

label: guilt
text: "Guilt at having pressed another person to expose/explore his personal weaknesses/faults, to the extent that the other person was made to feel terrible/defensive."

label: sadness
text: When I was told that my father had passed away.

label: fear
text: "When I was dreaming that I was being chased, in the upmost of horror the door of the closed felt down synchronicaly with the dream scare."

label: shame
text: One day in the intimity with my girlfriend I had an ejaculation.

label: anger
text: When fired unjustly from a job as casual bar-person. Charged with giving away free drinks. Not done so and had witnesses to prove it - both patrons and bar staff. Other staff were supportive.

label: shame
text: "My teacher reminded us not to do a Summer job, however I did it for two months.  Yesterday I was chatting with my teacher and when we talked of the Summer job, I felt ashamed."

label: shame
text: Swearing in public.

label: guilt
text: I escaped from communicating with God for a long time.  I did not read the scriptures and I did not pray.  I felt that I was getting further and further away from God.  I felt guilty as this was because of my laziness.

label: sadness
text: My sister bkoke her leg.

label: shame
text: I was ashamed when I was being introduced to the church congregation.

label: shame
text: When I almost did something awful with a friend of mine and myself.

label: guilt
text: "A certain woman had asked me to make something for her and I kept putting it off.  When I finally made it, I did not see her for days only to be told one day that she had collapsed and died.  I felt quite guilty as she had jokingly said that I might not do what she had requested me to do."

label: anger
text: When my sister took my things without having asked for my permission first.

label: sadness
text: When I was not selected to go to the University of Malawi I felt very sad.

label: disgust
text: I went to eat at my aunt's house and she served macaroni with a horrible appearence. I felt the sensation above. The worst was that I was practically obliged to eat.

label: guilt
text: Family discord and uneasiness due to something I did not communicate on time.

label: guilt
text: "After having been told not to take the car, I took it anyway and felt guilty about having taken it."

label: guilt
text: It was when I discovered that the girl who I had proposed was a friend's girlfriend.

label: fear
text: When I was in my village one of my enemies had written a non-sense letter to a girl and he told the father of this girl that I was the culprit.  When I got to know this I was scared as  the girl's father was a worse man.

label: guilt
text: Once I promised to do something but I didn't do it.

label: sadness
text: When my mother was very sick and almost died.

label: anger
text: "During the Christmas holdidays I wanted to invite my brother, his girlfriend and their child for dinner. When I said to my brother's girlfriend that I would like them to come at my place for dinner, she refused and never mentioned it again as if I had never asked her."

label: anger
text: "A co-worker and I had to rush a project. I was only working there for one month and he for some years. Instead of letting me know that he wanted to do the project himself, he went to the superviser and let the superviser tell me to let the co-worker do it himself since he was quicker at it."

label: shame
text: "First weekend back home after one week at Uni I scolded one of my sister's best friends for using our telephone. Very silly, but I was annoyed because she was there at a time when I needed to be with my family."

label: joy
text: When I gave birth to a healthy boy.

label: anger
text: "I've a situation of responsibility an employee who had a habit of being late, came late again after promising to say he would be at work in a few minutes, then arrived 3 hours later. He had been drinking."

label: disgust
text: "We had come back from a programme and we were all (three girls)    staying over at another girls placce.  One of them started passing very nasty and outright bitchy remarks at me.  It was brought on by a male colleague's compliments to me, this girl was herself interested in this guy.  Bitchiness and catty remarks made by women never fail to disgust me.  I can particularly remember this incident as she knew that I had not encouraged the  guy."

label: sadness
text: "It was the time I went home for my holidays only to find that my sister had passed away.  The news had been hidden from me, so that I could take my exams."

label: shame
text: The girl with whom I was going around had been forbidden to be alone with me in the house.  We paid no attention to this prohibition but one day her parents appeared and I jumped out of the window.  They saw me.

label: guilt
text: "Once after falling in love, I imagined that particular girl to be perfect and completely overshadowing my girlfriend. Afterwards I realized that this image was not objective. I felt guilty against both girls."

label: anger
text: Quarreling with classmates.

label: guilt
text: Once when I was in the cell group (religious activity) I found that almost everyone in the group read the bible daily and I felt guilty in my heart.

label: anger
text: "When bicycling along, a courier van started to tail me very close - I sped up and moved over and he just did the same. I reacted violently, much physical responding in the dangerous situation."

label: joy
text: When I learnt that I had been admitted to the university.

label: shame
text: When not fulfilling any of my obligations to a person whom I respect.

label: joy
text: "At a party, on New Year's Eve, I met on old friend whom I had not seen for some time"

label: anger
text: When they denied a job to a person that I propsed giving political reasons that has nothing to do directly with the professional level.

label: joy
text: Going to Chico to visit a friend.

label: sadness
text: Death of a pet rabbit. We had to give it away because my brother became allergic to it. We gave it to a man who kept animals and lots of other animals for children to watch. We went to visit our rabbit. It was badly beaten by the other rabbits and eventually died.

label: sadness
text: "Being away from a very close friend, I was away from Finland for a year as an exchange student."

label: disgust
text: ""When an acquaintance (he was drunk) of my room-mate vomitted on the kitchen carpet.  It was past mid-night and my room-mate had just moved in, this acquaintance had helped her move in."

label: sadness
text: This monday I took a Math 1BS test and flunked for the second time.

label: sadness
text: I felt sad when a friend of mine died and I felt that something had irrevocably gone away from me.

label: fear
text: "When we stayed in Vienna with our class, my friend and I behaved incorrectly. Our teacher threatened us with exclusion from school."

label: guilt
text: My father got a slight heart attack after a telephone call of mine.

label: disgust
text: I was very disgusted the first day I went to put a dead body in the Mortuary. There were many dead bodies and some were uncovered so we had to put on top of the other bodies.

label: sadness
text: At the death of my husband's father's mother which occurred during university examinations and therefore I was unable to attend her funeral.

label: fear
text: My father had been drinking and I feared him when we went to bed at night.

label: joy
text: Getting a letter from a friend who did not write for a long time.

label: guilt
text: Stealing money from a milk token jar from a close friend of the family when visiting.

label: shame
text: In my opinion guilt is a feeling which goes together with shame. Here then I refer to the situation of guilt.

label: disgust
text: A young man was insulting and humiliating a drunken man.

label: sadness
text: The death of my guardian with whom I had stayed when I did my grade six.

label: guilt
text: Promised to do something for other people and did not do it.

label: joy
text: "After going through much shame, I became a Christian and something new happened in my heart.  Joy that overflows was manifest in me."

label: anger
text: I missed the train and had to wait for the next for two hours. For this reason I missed an appointment which had been very important for me.

label: anger
text: The headmistress at a secondary school accused me of banging the classroom door when I didn't in front of the whole class.

label: anger
text: "I was at home, filling my tax report.  Nobody had time to help me.  I would have liked to do it quickly so that I could go and meet a friend of mine who had just returned from hospital.  I got angry as both my brother and my father refused to give me their calculator as I had not asked for it nicely.  I could not leave as I had to wait for help and the tax report had to be done."

label: anger
text: "When talking with my sister, she often ventilates prejudices, which my father also adheres."

label: guilt
text: When my friends and I were caught with our girlfriends outside the school grounds when I was at the secondary school.  We were caught by the headmaster.

label: disgust
text: A man sexually aggressed a small girl in the bus but the girl did not dare to speak out.

label: anger
text: I was very angry one day when my husband ignored me and slept      on a separate bed.  He had no reasons to doubt me or to neglect me and I had never imagined that he could do such a thing.

label: sadness
text: "My brother came to tell me about some problems we had in the  family.  I felt sad because I thought that if my mother had not gone away when this brother was younger, things would have been different."

label: disgust
text: Getting into a crowded bus.

label: disgust
text: "During the PY 102 film session on Tuesday, one of the films shown  was of an experiment on a live cat involving strapping it into a machine for possibly days, and doing things to its brain."

label: anger
text: Doing a group assignment and being left to do all the work and take the blame for any mistakes.

label: shame
text: When I arrived late at the job and met the most troublesome boss.

label: sadness
text: When another person's mother died.

label: shame
text: Teacher suspected me stealing money.

label: guilt
text: When I flew out to my mother and made rude remarks because I felt so tense (studied too hard for an examination).

label: shame
text: When I received a letter from my girlfriend telling me that she was engaged to an another man.

label: sadness
text: "When I heard that my girlfriend was getting married to another person, I felt very sad.  That day I did not eat anything and kept thinking of her all day long."

label: anger
text: "My peers didn't want me to meet someone during rush for fear that I would give her a bad outlook on our Sororoty house. I shouldn't have seen this, but they blew and I did."

label: disgust
text: "When I was touring Asia with my present football team, I saw old Europeans with young asiatic prostitutes."

label: shame
text: My teacher said that being university studets we did not have any self-initiative or self-control.

label: anger
text: Sometime ago I felt very angry when my mother wrote me telling me that my elder sister was messing up things at home by her internalised aggressive attitude towards parents and her husband.

label: shame
text: I ate very fattening food in front of my boyfriend who would like me to lose weight. I am supposedly pursuing a modelling career but first I must lose weight. I had been trying to diet.

label: joy
text: I received a grade above average on a midterm (chemistry) and I expected onevery below average.

label: anger
text: When I was beaten up by thieves on behalf of some friends of mine as they thought that I had a lot of money and would not part with a few coins for their drinks.

label: disgust
text: "When thieves broke into our house, I was disgusted by their behaviour.  They did not find anything so they broke things like the windows, glasses etc."

label: fear
text: "As a child, when I was at home alone, I felt in an indefinate manner afraid of the death of my father and mother."

label: joy
text: When my son returned from mountaineering - healthy in body and soul.

label: fear
text: "Before an exam which I, finally did not take."

label: disgust
text: "When Kanishka was blown up, I really felt disgusted at people killing each other."

label: anger
text: I once caught a letter in my girlfriend's handbag from a certain man. I felt anger.

label: guilt
text: When I was caught stealing mangoes in a certain compound.

label: disgust
text: I had intercourse with someone and then I realized that what I had done was wrong and it disgusted me.

label: shame
text: "I was with my colleagues and we met an elderly man who was very drunk, as he approached us he started to undress."

label: joy
text: Found out that me and my best friend are both chosen for the English lectures.

label: disgust
text: "I was disgusted when I was told to dress a big rotten stinky wound which, coming closer, made me feel like vomitting."

label: fear
text: We were driving at night and I realized that a car was following us.

label: anger
text: During military service a superior reproached me unjustly. This led to friction in a lot of situations.

label: shame
text: I received the results of the test paper of my major subject and I found that my result was not as good as a classmate who had recently changed his major subject.    I felt very ashamed.

label: fear
text: "Once, when I was ten, I could not remember why my mother was so angry.  She fainted suddenly and I was very scared as I did not know what to do ."

label: guilt
text: "I felt guilty when I spent a night at my boyfriend's place, particularly because I had been harsh and spiteful when I had left home.  The reason was that I feared a possible discussion on the subject and I wanted to leave defiantly."
